name: COSO Principle 1: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.
description: COSO Principle 1: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.

subcontrols.name: Sets the Tone at the Top - The board of directors and management, at all levels, demonstrate through their directives, actions, and behavior the importance of integrity and ethical values to support the functioning of the system of internal control.
subcontrols.description: Sets the Tone at the Top - The board of directors and management, at all levels, demonstrate through their directives, actions, and behavior the importance of integrity and ethical values to support the functioning of the system of internal control.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure leadership consistently models ethical behavior and prioritizes integrity. Communicate clear expectations for ethical conduct throughout the organization. Regularly evaluate adherence to these principles at all levels. Reinforce ethical decision-making through training and consistent messaging.  Demonstrate commitment through policies, actions, and fostering a culture that values ethics.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Standards of Conduct - The expectations of the board of directors and senior management concerning integrity and ethical values are defined in the entity's standards of conduct and understood at all levels of the entity and by outsourced service providers and business partners.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Standards of Conduct - The expectations of the board of directors and senior management concerning integrity and ethical values are defined in the entity's standards of conduct and understood at all levels of the entity and by outsourced service providers and business partners.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, create a clear code of conduct outlining ethical expectations for everyone, including the board, management, and external parties. Ensure this document is easily accessible and understood by all.  Regularly communicate and reinforce these standards through training and updates.  Document adherence to the code to demonstrate compliance.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates Adherence to Standards of Conduct - Processes are in place to evaluate the performance of individuals and teams against the entity's expected standards of conduct.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates Adherence to Standards of Conduct - Processes are in place to evaluate the performance of individuals and teams against the entity's expected standards of conduct.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure adherence to the code of conduct, implement regular performance reviews. These reviews should directly assess employee and team adherence to ethical standards. Use feedback from these evaluations to identify areas for improvement and reinforce desired behaviors. Document any violations and take appropriate corrective action. Consistently applying these processes fosters a culture of ethical conduct.

subcontrols.name: Addresses Deviations in a Timely Manner - Deviations from the entity's expected standards of conduct are identified and remedied in a timely and consistent manner.
subcontrols.description: Addresses Deviations in a Timely Manner - Deviations from the entity's expected standards of conduct are identified and remedied in a timely and consistent manner.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires prompt correction of any violations of your company's rules.  Establish clear procedures for reporting and investigating deviations.  Implement a process for documenting remediation steps and timelines.  Ensure consistent enforcement of standards across all departments.  Regularly review and update policies and procedures.

subcontrols.name: Considers Contractors and Vendor Employees in Demonstrating Its Commitment - Management and the board of directors consider the use of contractors and vendor employees in its processes for establishing standards of conduct, evaluating adherence to those standards, and addressing deviations in a timely manner.
subcontrols.description: Considers Contractors and Vendor Employees in Demonstrating Its Commitment - Management and the board of directors consider the use of contractors and vendor employees in its processes for establishing standards of conduct, evaluating adherence to those standards, and addressing deviations in a timely manner.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your code of conduct and related policies explicitly apply to contractors and vendor employees. Establish clear expectations for their behavior and adherence to your security protocols. Regularly monitor their compliance through audits, reviews, or questionnaires. Address any violations or deviations promptly and consistently. This demonstrates management's commitment to security across your entire workforce.

name: COSO Principle 2: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal control.
description: COSO Principle 2: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal control.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Oversight Responsibilities - The board of directors identifies and accepts its oversight responsibilities in relation to established requirements and expectations.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Oversight Responsibilities - The board of directors identifies and accepts its oversight responsibilities in relation to established requirements and expectations.
subcontrols.guidance: The board of directors must formally acknowledge and accept their responsibility for overseeing the company's SOC2 compliance. This includes understanding the established security requirements and expectations outlined in the SOC2 framework. Documentation of this acknowledgement, such as meeting minutes or a board resolution, is crucial. The board's oversight ensures accountability and commitment to maintaining a secure environment. This oversight provides assurance to stakeholders regarding the company's dedication to protecting sensitive data.

subcontrols.name: Applies Relevant Expertise - The board of directors defines, maintains, and periodically evaluates the skills and expertise needed among its members to enable them to ask probing questions of senior management and take commensurate action.
subcontrols.description: Applies Relevant Expertise - The board of directors defines, maintains, and periodically evaluates the skills and expertise needed among its members to enable them to ask probing questions of senior management and take commensurate action.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your board possesses diverse expertise relevant to your organization's activities and industry. Regularly assess board members' skills and experience against evolving needs. This allows the board to effectively challenge management and make informed decisions. Document the defined expertise and evaluation processes for SOC 2 compliance. By demonstrating competency, you fulfill the control's requirements.

subcontrols.name: Operates Independently - The board of directors has sufficient members who are independent from management and objective in evaluations and decision making.
subcontrols.description: Operates Independently - The board of directors has sufficient members who are independent from management and objective in evaluations and decision making.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your board of directors includes independent members, free from management influence. These independent directors should actively participate in evaluations and decision-making processes. Their objective perspective is crucial for unbiased oversight. This promotes accountability and protects stakeholder interests. Document and demonstrate the independence of your board members.

subcontrols.name: Supplements Board Expertise - The board of directors supplements its expertise relevant to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy, as needed, through the use of a subcommittee or consultants.
subcontrols.description: Supplements Board Expertise - The board of directors supplements its expertise relevant to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy, as needed, through the use of a subcommittee or consultants.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the "Supplements Board Expertise" SOC2 control, the board should actively identify skills gaps in security and privacy. This could be achieved by forming a security-focused subcommittee or hiring expert consultants. Document these efforts, including meeting minutes or consultant reports, to demonstrate ongoing board education and oversight related to these crucial areas. Ensure the board utilizes this supplemental expertise to guide security strategy.

name: COSO Principle 3: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.
description: COSO Principle 3: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

subcontrols.name: Considers All Structures of the Entity - Management and the board of directors consider the multiple structures used (including operating units, legal entities, geographic distribution, and outsourced service providers) to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Considers All Structures of the Entity - Management and the board of directors consider the multiple structures used (including operating units, legal entities, geographic distribution, and outsourced service providers) to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, your leadership team must map out all facets of your business: operating units, legal entities, locations, and any third-party providers. Analyze how these structures support your business goals, particularly those related to security and compliance. Document this analysis, demonstrating how management and the board understand and consider the implications of each structure. This ensures you're managing risks holistically.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Reporting Lines - Management designs and evaluates lines of reporting for each entity structure to enable execution of authorities and responsibilities and flow of information to manage the activities of the entity.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Reporting Lines - Management designs and evaluates lines of reporting for each entity structure to enable execution of authorities and responsibilities and flow of information to manage the activities of the entity.
subcontrols.guidance: Define clear reporting structures within your organization, specifying who reports to whom. These lines should facilitate efficient communication and ensure accountability. Regularly review and update these structures to adapt to organizational changes. Document the reporting lines in organizational charts or similar documentation. This helps with proper execution of responsibilities and effective information flow.

subcontrols.name: Defines, Assigns, and Limits Authorities and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors delegate authority, define responsibilities, and use appropriate processes and technology to assign responsibility and segregate duties as necessary at the various levels of the organization.
subcontrols.description: Defines, Assigns, and Limits Authorities and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors delegate authority, define responsibilities, and use appropriate processes and technology to assign responsibility and segregate duties as necessary at the various levels of the organization.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a clear structure defining roles and responsibilities across the organization, especially from management down. Document delegated authorities and responsibilities to ensure accountability and segregation of duties. Implement processes and technologies like access controls to enforce these assignments. Regularly review and update roles to reflect organizational changes. Ensure the board of directors understands their oversight responsibilities.

subcontrols.name: Addresses Specific Requirements When Defining Authorities and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors consider requirements relevant to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy when defining authorities and responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Addresses Specific Requirements When Defining Authorities and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors consider requirements relevant to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy when defining authorities and responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: When defining roles, leadership must consider the security, availability, integrity, confidentiality, and privacy implications. This includes clearly outlining responsibilities and granting appropriate authority to manage these aspects. Documentation is key; ensure these authorities and responsibilities are formally documented and communicated. This helps prevent gaps and overlaps, ensuring accountability for each control objective. Management and the board bear ultimate responsibility for oversight.

subcontrols.name: Considers Interactions With External Parties When Establishing Structures, Reporting Lines, Authorities, and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors consider the need for the entity to interact with and monitor the activities of external parties when establishing structures, reporting lines, authorities, and responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Considers Interactions With External Parties When Establishing Structures, Reporting Lines, Authorities, and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors consider the need for the entity to interact with and monitor the activities of external parties when establishing structures, reporting lines, authorities, and responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: This control emphasizes external relationships in your organizational structure.  Define clear reporting lines and responsibilities for interactions with vendors, partners, and other external entities. Establish authorities for managing these relationships to ensure secure data handling and compliance. Regularly monitor external party activities to identify and mitigate risks tied to their access or involvement. Finally, document the specific structures, reporting lines, and authorities that are put in place.

name: COSO Principle 4: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.
description: COSO Principle 4: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Policies and Practices - Policies and practices reflect expectations of competence necessary to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Policies and Practices - Policies and practices reflect expectations of competence necessary to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes setting clear performance expectations. Define specific skills and knowledge needed for each role. Document these expectations within your policies and practices. Ensure all team members understand and can meet these competencies to achieve company goals. Regularly review and update these standards as needed.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates Competence and Addresses Shortcomings - The board of directors and management evaluate competence across the entity and in outsourced service providers in relation to established policies and practices and act as necessary to address shortcomings.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates Competence and Addresses Shortcomings - The board of directors and management evaluate competence across the entity and in outsourced service providers in relation to established policies and practices and act as necessary to address shortcomings.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the SOC2 control regarding competence, regularly assess employee and vendor skills against your policies. Identify and document any skill gaps or performance issues. Implement training, performance improvement plans, or consider personnel changes to address identified shortcomings. Ensure ongoing monitoring to maintain competence levels across your organization and service providers.

subcontrols.name: Attracts, Develops, and Retains Individuals - The entity provides the mentoring and training needed to attract, develop, and retain sufficient and competent personnel and outsourced service providers to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Attracts, Develops, and Retains Individuals - The entity provides the mentoring and training needed to attract, develop, and retain sufficient and competent personnel and outsourced service providers to support the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the SOC2 control for attracting, developing, and retaining talent, focus on consistent training programs, mentorship opportunities, and performance reviews.  Document these activities. Offer competitive compensation and benefits. Ensure that ongoing training and development meets current job requirements and anticipates future needs.

subcontrols.name: Plans and Prepares for Succession - Senior management and the board of directors develop contingency plans for assignments of responsibility important for internal control.
subcontrols.description: Plans and Prepares for Succession - Senior management and the board of directors develop contingency plans for assignments of responsibility important for internal control.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure a documented succession plan exists for key roles impacting security and internal controls. This plan should outline responsibilities during transitions caused by departure, disability, or other unforeseen events. Regularly review and update the plan, including documented approvals from senior management and the board. Communicate the plan effectively to all relevant personnel.  The plan should enable continuous oversight and control.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Background of Individuals - The entity considers the background of potential and existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees when determining whether to employ and retain the individuals.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Background of Individuals - The entity considers the background of potential and existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees when determining whether to employ and retain the individuals.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure thorough background checks are conducted on all new hires, contractors, and vendors before granting access to sensitive data or systems. This includes verifying identity, employment history, and criminal records where permitted by law. Re-evaluate backgrounds periodically for existing personnel and contractors. Implement policies for addressing any adverse findings, such as disqualification or remediation. This helps mitigate risks of insider threats and protects valuable information.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Technical Competency of Individuals - The entity considers the technical competency of potential and existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees when determining whether to employ and retain the individuals.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Technical Competency of Individuals - The entity considers the technical competency of potential and existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees when determining whether to employ and retain the individuals.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure individuals possess necessary technical skills for their roles. Evaluate competency during hiring and performance reviews. Provide ongoing training to maintain and enhance technical expertise.  Verify vendor/contractor technical capabilities. Document assessments and training for audit compliance.

subcontrols.name: Provides Training to Maintain Technical Competencies -  The entity provides training programs, including continuing education and training, to ensure skill sets and technical competency of existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees are developed and maintained.
subcontrols.description: Provides Training to Maintain Technical Competencies -  The entity provides training programs, including continuing education and training, to ensure skill sets and technical competency of existing personnel, contractors, and vendor employees are developed and maintained.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a training program to maintain employee technical skills. This includes initial and ongoing training, like continuing education.  Document training completion and measure its effectiveness.  Ensure training covers relevant technologies and security practices.  Include contractors and vendors in appropriate training programs.

name: COSO Principle 5: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.
description: COSO Principle 5: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

subcontrols.name: Enforces Accountability Through Structures, Authorities, and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors establish the mechanisms to communicate and hold individuals accountable for performance of internal control responsibilities across the entity and implement corrective action as necessary.
subcontrols.description: Enforces Accountability Through Structures, Authorities, and Responsibilities - Management and the board of directors establish the mechanisms to communicate and hold individuals accountable for performance of internal control responsibilities across the entity and implement corrective action as necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear roles and responsibilities for internal controls, with defined authorities. Management and the board must communicate these responsibilities and expectations throughout the organization. Regularly assess performance against these controls.  Address any deficiencies promptly through corrective actions. This ensures accountability and strengthens your SOC2 compliance.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Performance Measures, Incentives, and Rewards - Management and the board of directors establish performance measures, incentives, and other rewards appropriate for responsibilities at all levels of the entity, reflecting appropriate dimensions of performance and expected standards of conduct, and considering the achievement of both short-term and longer-term objectives.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Performance Measures, Incentives, and Rewards - Management and the board of directors establish performance measures, incentives, and other rewards appropriate for responsibilities at all levels of the entity, reflecting appropriate dimensions of performance and expected standards of conduct, and considering the achievement of both short-term and longer-term objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires establishing clear performance metrics, incentives, and rewards across the organization. Management and the board must define these to align with responsibilities and ethical standards.  Consider both short-term and long-term objectives when designing these programs.  Ensure these are documented and communicated to all levels.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates Performance Measures, Incentives, and Rewards for Ongoing Relevance - Management and the board of directors align incentives and rewards with the fulfillment of internal control responsibilities in the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates Performance Measures, Incentives, and Rewards for Ongoing Relevance - Management and the board of directors align incentives and rewards with the fulfillment of internal control responsibilities in the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure ongoing relevance, regularly review performance measures, incentives, and rewards.  Confirm they directly support and encourage effective internal control performance.  Management and the board should align these elements to promote achieving organizational objectives. This alignment fosters a culture prioritizing strong control practices.  Address any gaps or misalignments promptly through adjustments.

subcontrols.name: Considers Excessive Pressures - Management and the board of directors evaluate and adjust pressures associated with the achievement of objectives as they assign responsibilities, develop performance measures, and evaluate performance.
subcontrols.description: Considers Excessive Pressures - Management and the board of directors evaluate and adjust pressures associated with the achievement of objectives as they assign responsibilities, develop performance measures, and evaluate performance.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes balancing objectives with realistic pressures. Management and the board must carefully assess and adjust demands placed on employees. They should ensure performance measures don't encourage shortcuts or unethical behavior. Regularly evaluate performance, considering whether pressures contribute to potential risks. Ultimately, the goal is a sustainable environment fostering ethical conduct and quality outcomes.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates Performance and Rewards or Disciplines Individuals - Management and the board of directors evaluate performance of internal control responsibilities, including adherence to standards of conduct and expected levels of competence, and provide rewards or exercise disciplinary action, as appropriate.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates Performance and Rewards or Disciplines Individuals - Management and the board of directors evaluate performance of internal control responsibilities, including adherence to standards of conduct and expected levels of competence, and provide rewards or exercise disciplinary action, as appropriate.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure individuals with internal control responsibilities are regularly evaluated. This includes assessing their adherence to conduct standards and skill levels. Recognize strong performance through rewards. Address deficiencies or non-compliance with appropriate disciplinary action. This process demonstrates accountability and reinforces the importance of internal controls.

name: COSO Principle 13: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.
description: COSO Principle 13: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Information Requirements - A process is in place to identify the information required and expected to support the functioning of the other components of internal control and the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Information Requirements - A process is in place to identify the information required and expected to support the functioning of the other components of internal control and the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, define what information is crucial for your organization's functions and objectives.  Document how you identify these requirements, considering both current needs and future growth. Ensure this process includes input from relevant departments and stakeholders. Regularly review and update these information requirements to stay relevant and effective. Lastly, align the information with security policies.

subcontrols.name: Captures Internal and External Sources of Data - Information systems capture internal and external sources of data.
subcontrols.description: Captures Internal and External Sources of Data - Information systems capture internal and external sources of data.
subcontrols.guidance: Verify your systems log data from all relevant sources, both inside and outside your organization. Document the specific data captured, including the source, format, and purpose of collection. Ensure all captured data aligns with your stated data privacy policies. Regularly review these data capture mechanisms for accuracy, completeness, and security.

subcontrols.name: Processes Relevant Data Into Information - Information systems process and transform relevant data into information.
subcontrols.description: Processes Relevant Data Into Information - Information systems process and transform relevant data into information.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your systems properly transform raw data into meaningful, usable information. Implement and document clear data processing procedures. Verify accuracy through validation checks and regular audits. Protect the integrity of transformed information throughout its lifecycle. Regularly review and improve your data processing methods.

subcontrols.name: Maintains Quality Throughout Processing - Information systems produce information that is timely, current, accurate, complete, accessible, protected, verifiable, and retained. Information is reviewed to assess its relevance in supporting the internal control components.
subcontrols.description: Maintains Quality Throughout Processing - Information systems produce information that is timely, current, accurate, complete, accessible, protected, verifiable, and retained. Information is reviewed to assess its relevance in supporting the internal control components.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure data integrity by implementing data validation checks, data quality monitoring, and regular audits to verify data accuracy. Establish clear procedures for data entry, processing, and access, and review these procedures periodically. Implement retention policies for data and ensure data backups for availability and disaster recovery. This improves the reliability of your system.

name: COSO Principle 14: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.
description: COSO Principle 14: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Internal Control Information - A process is in place to communicate required information to enable all personnel to understand and carry out their internal control responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Internal Control Information - A process is in place to communicate required information to enable all personnel to understand and carry out their internal control responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all employees understand their security responsibilities. Regularly distribute relevant policies, procedures, and updates. Provide training and awareness programs to reinforce control understanding. Utilize clear communication channels like email, intranet, and meetings. Document these communication efforts as evidence of compliance.

subcontrols.name: Communicates With the Board of Directors - Communication exists between management and the board of directors so that both have information needed to fulfill their roles with respect to the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Communicates With the Board of Directors - Communication exists between management and the board of directors so that both have information needed to fulfill their roles with respect to the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly brief your Board of Directors on key security matters, including risks, incidents, and the overall effectiveness of your security program. Ensure clear communication channels are established and used consistently. Provide timely and relevant reports that align with board responsibilities and the organization's objectives. Document all communications for audit purposes. This ensures the board has the information to provide effective oversight.

subcontrols.name: Provides Separate Communication Lines - Separate communication channels, such as whistle-blower hotlines, are in place and serve as fail-safe mechanisms to enable anonymous or confidential communication when normal channels are inoperative or ineffective.
subcontrols.description: Provides Separate Communication Lines - Separate communication channels, such as whistle-blower hotlines, are in place and serve as fail-safe mechanisms to enable anonymous or confidential communication when normal channels are inoperative or ineffective.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure multiple, independent communication avenues exist for reporting issues, especially anonymously. These should bypass standard reporting processes.  Examples include a whistleblower hotline or dedicated email address.  Test these channels regularly to ensure accessibility and confidentiality. Document procedures for handling reported concerns.

subcontrols.name: Selects Relevant Method of Communication - The method of communication considers the timing, audience, and nature of the information.
subcontrols.description: Selects Relevant Method of Communication - The method of communication considers the timing, audience, and nature of the information.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure you choose communication methods (email, chat, meetings) best suited to the timing, who needs to receive the information, and the information's sensitivity. Prioritize secure and reliable channels for sensitive data. Consider audience preferences for optimal engagement. Document your communication plan to standardize this process.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Responsibilities - Entity personnel with responsibility for designing, developing, implementing, operating, maintaining, or monitoring system controls receive communications about their responsibilities, including changes in their responsibilities, and have the information necessary to carry out those responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Responsibilities - Entity personnel with responsibility for designing, developing, implementing, operating, maintaining, or monitoring system controls receive communications about their responsibilities, including changes in their responsibilities, and have the information necessary to carry out those responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: Clearly define each employee's role in maintaining system controls, providing detailed documentation. Regularly update responsibilities as processes evolve and communicate changes promptly. Ensure all personnel understand their assigned tasks through training and readily available resources.  Document all communication and training efforts.  This promotes accountability and effective control execution.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information on Reporting Failures, Incidents, Concerns, and Other Matters - Entity personnel are provided with information on how to report systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to personnel.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information on Reporting Failures, Incidents, Concerns, and Other Matters - Entity personnel are provided with information on how to report systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to personnel.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure employees understand the process for reporting issues like system failures or security incidents.  Clearly communicate reporting methods (e.g., email, help desk) and who to contact.  Provide accessible documentation outlining these procedures. Regular training or reminders reinforce this knowledge.  Document the existence and content of the reporting communication.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Objectives and Changes to Objectives  - The entity communicates its objectives and changes to those objectives to personnel in a timely manner.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Objectives and Changes to Objectives  - The entity communicates its objectives and changes to those objectives to personnel in a timely manner.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the SOC2 control, clearly define and document your company's objectives.  Share these objectives, and any updates, with all relevant personnel promptly.  Use various communication methods to ensure widespread understanding. Document your communication efforts for audit purposes. This helps everyone align with company goals.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information to Improve Security Knowledge and Awareness - The entity communicates information to improve security knowledge and awareness and to model appropriate security behaviors to personnel through a security awareness training program.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information to Improve Security Knowledge and Awareness - The entity communicates information to improve security knowledge and awareness and to model appropriate security behaviors to personnel through a security awareness training program.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a comprehensive security awareness training program for all personnel. This program should communicate crucial security information, promoting understanding of threats and best practices.  Regular training reinforces desired security behaviors.  Track participation and assess understanding through quizzes or exercises.  Update the program frequently to address evolving risks and emerging threats.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information About System Operation and Boundaries - The entity prepares and communicates information about the design and operation of the system and its boundaries to authorized personnel to enable them to understand their role in the system and the results of system operation.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information About System Operation and Boundaries - The entity prepares and communicates information about the design and operation of the system and its boundaries to authorized personnel to enable them to understand their role in the system and the results of system operation.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, clearly document your system's architecture, including its boundaries, and how it operates. Share this documentation with relevant personnel so they understand their responsibilities within the system. Regularly update this information to reflect any changes. This ensures everyone is informed about the system's inner workings and their specific contributions. Consider using diagrams and workflows for clear communication.

subcontrols.name: Communicates System Objectives - The entity communicates its objectives to personnel to enable them to carry out their responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Communicates System Objectives - The entity communicates its objectives to personnel to enable them to carry out their responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure SOC 2 compliance for communicating system objectives, clearly document and disseminate the objectives for all relevant systems to your personnel.  This communication should happen during onboarding and regularly thereafter.  Confirm understanding through training and acknowledgement.  Regularly review and update objectives as the system evolves. This fosters a shared understanding of goals and promotes effective task execution.

subcontrols.name: Communicates System Changes - System changes that affect responsibilities or the achievement of the entity's objectives are communicated in a timely manner.
subcontrols.description: Communicates System Changes - System changes that affect responsibilities or the achievement of the entity's objectives are communicated in a timely manner.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the "Communicates System Changes" SOC2 control, promptly inform relevant stakeholders about any system updates impacting their roles or company goals. This communication should detail the change, its impact, and any required actions. Use appropriate channels for effective dissemination, ensuring all affected parties receive and understand the information. Maintain records of these communications for audit purposes.

name: COSO Principle 15: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.
description: COSO Principle 15: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

subcontrols.name: Communicates to External Parties - Processes are in place to communicate relevant and timely information to external parties, including shareholders, partners, owners, regulators, customers, financial analysts, and other external parties.
subcontrols.description: Communicates to External Parties - Processes are in place to communicate relevant and timely information to external parties, including shareholders, partners, owners, regulators, customers, financial analysts, and other external parties.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear channels and procedures for sharing crucial information with external stakeholders. Ensure information is accurate, timely, and relevant to each audience. Document these communication processes for consistency and auditability. Regularly review and update communication methods based on stakeholder feedback and evolving needs. Confirm that sensitive data shared externally is protected and compliant.

subcontrols.name: Enables Inbound Communications - Open communication channels allow input from customers, consumers, suppliers, external auditors, regulators, financial analysts, and others, providing management and the board of directors with relevant information.
subcontrols.description: Enables Inbound Communications - Open communication channels allow input from customers, consumers, suppliers, external auditors, regulators, financial analysts, and others, providing management and the board of directors with relevant information.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the "Enables Inbound Communications" SOC2 control, establish clear communication channels for various stakeholders, including customers and auditors. Document these channels and ensure they are consistently monitored for incoming information. Implement processes to promptly address inquiries, complaints, and feedback received through these established avenues. This enables the organization to gather important insights and address potential issues effectively.

subcontrols.name: Communicates With the Board of Directors - Relevant information resulting from assessments conducted by external parties is communicated to the board of directors.
subcontrols.description: Communicates With the Board of Directors - Relevant information resulting from assessments conducted by external parties is communicated to the board of directors.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your board receives summaries and key findings from all external SOC 2 assessments.  Present these findings in a clear, concise format, highlighting risks and any identified vulnerabilities.  Include remediation plans and timelines for addressing any gaps or weaknesses uncovered.  Regular communication helps the board fulfill its oversight responsibilities regarding security posture. Documentation of these communications is crucial for audit purposes.

subcontrols.name: Provides Separate Communication Lines - Separate communication channels, such as whistle-blower hotlines, are in place and serve as fail-safe mechanisms to enable anonymous or confidential communication when normal channels are inoperative or ineffective.
subcontrols.description: Provides Separate Communication Lines - Separate communication channels, such as whistle-blower hotlines, are in place and serve as fail-safe mechanisms to enable anonymous or confidential communication when normal channels are inoperative or ineffective.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish and publicize alternative communication channels beyond standard methods. These channels, like a whistleblower hotline, should ensure anonymous or confidential reporting. Ensure these fail-safe mechanisms remain operational and accessible. These channels are critical when typical communication is unavailable or inadequate. This strengthens your organization's commitment to transparency and accountability.

subcontrols.name: Selects Relevant Method of Communication - The method of communication considers the timing, audience, and nature of the communication and legal, regulatory, and fiduciary requirements and expectations.
subcontrols.description: Selects Relevant Method of Communication - The method of communication considers the timing, audience, and nature of the communication and legal, regulatory, and fiduciary requirements and expectations.
subcontrols.guidance: Choose communication methods based on who you're talking to, when, and what's being discussed. Consider legal, regulatory, and financial obligations. Securely transmit sensitive data via the appropriate channels, such as encrypted email or secure portals. Ensure the communication method aligns with data sensitivity levels and applicable policies. Document the rationale behind chosen communication methods for audit purposes.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Objectives Related to Confidentiality and Changes to Objectives -  The entity communicates, to external users, vendors, business partners and others whose products and services are part of the system, objectives and changes to objectives related to confidentiality.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Objectives Related to Confidentiality and Changes to Objectives -  The entity communicates, to external users, vendors, business partners and others whose products and services are part of the system, objectives and changes to objectives related to confidentiality.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, clearly define and document confidentiality objectives.  Share these objectives, and any revisions, with relevant external parties.  Communication methods should be appropriate for the audience, ensuring understanding.  Maintain records of these communications.  Finally, regularly review and update objectives as needed.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Objectives Related to Privacy and Changes to Objectives - The entity communicates, to external users, vendors, business partners and others whose products and services are part of the system, objectives related to privacy and changes to those objectives.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Objectives Related to Privacy and Changes to Objectives - The entity communicates, to external users, vendors, business partners and others whose products and services are part of the system, objectives related to privacy and changes to those objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, clearly define your privacy objectives.  Share these objectives with relevant external parties like vendors.  Document any changes to these objectives and promptly communicate those updates. Ensure this communication is accessible and understandable to all recipients.  This builds trust and transparency.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information About System Operation and Boundaries - The entity prepares and communicates information about the design and operation of the system and its boundaries to authorized external users to permit users to understand their role in the system and the results of system operation.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information About System Operation and Boundaries - The entity prepares and communicates information about the design and operation of the system and its boundaries to authorized external users to permit users to understand their role in the system and the results of system operation.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, clearly document your system's design, operational processes, and limitations.  Provide this information to authorized external users (like customers) so they understand their responsibilities and how the system functions.  This transparency helps users understand the impact of their actions and the expected outcomes. Ensure this documentation is readily accessible, current, and easy to understand.

subcontrols.name: Communicates System Objectives - The entity communicates its system objectives to appropriate external users.
subcontrols.description: Communicates System Objectives - The entity communicates its system objectives to appropriate external users.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with the SOC2 control, clearly define and document your system's objectives, specifying what it's designed to achieve. Share these documented objectives with relevant external users (e.g., clients, partners).  Ensure the communication is easy to understand and accessible. Periodically review and update the objectives and communication as needed.

subcontrols.name: Communicates System Responsibilities - External users with responsibility for designing, developing, implementing, operating, maintaining, and monitoring system controls receive communications about their responsibilities and have the information necessary to carry out those responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Communicates System Responsibilities - External users with responsibility for designing, developing, implementing, operating, maintaining, and monitoring system controls receive communications about their responsibilities and have the information necessary to carry out those responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: Clearly define and document all system responsibilities for external users involved in control activities.  Provide these users with tailored, accessible training materials.  Establish a communication plan to proactively inform users of changes or updates to their responsibilities.  Regularly review and update materials to ensure accuracy and effectiveness. Confirm understanding through acknowledgment or testing to ensure successful execution of responsibilities.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information on Reporting System Failures, Incidents, Concerns, and Other Matters - External users are provided with information on how to report systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to appropriate personnel.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information on Reporting System Failures, Incidents, Concerns, and Other Matters - External users are provided with information on how to report systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to appropriate personnel.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a clear, accessible communication channel for external users to report issues.  This should include instructions for reporting system failures, incidents, and concerns.  Publicize this channel via your website, documentation, or other readily available sources.  Ensure reported issues are tracked and resolved promptly.  Finally, proactively communicate status updates if issues impact external users.

name: COSO Principle 6: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.
description: COSO Principle 6: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

subcontrols.name: Reflects Management's Choices - Operations objectives reflect management's choices about structure, industry considerations, and performance of the entity.
subcontrols.description: Reflects Management's Choices - Operations objectives reflect management's choices about structure, industry considerations, and performance of the entity.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes aligning operational objectives with management's strategic vision. Ensure operational goals directly support the company's chosen structure, industry context, and desired performance.  Document how management's decisions influence operational objectives, demonstrating a clear link between strategy and execution. Regularly review and update objectives to reflect evolving business priorities. This helps ensure efficient and effective operations.

subcontrols.name: Considers Tolerances for Risk - Management considers the acceptable levels of variation relative to the achievement of operations objectives.
subcontrols.description: Considers Tolerances for Risk - Management considers the acceptable levels of variation relative to the achievement of operations objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Define acceptable risk levels for each operational objective. Establish tolerance thresholds for key metrics related to those objectives. Regularly monitor performance against these tolerances. Take corrective actions if deviations exceed the defined thresholds, and document any adjustments made. This process ensures operations stay within acceptable risk boundaries.

subcontrols.name: Includes Operations and Financial Performance Goals - The organization reflects the desired level of operations and financial performance for the entity within operations objectives.
subcontrols.description: Includes Operations and Financial Performance Goals - The organization reflects the desired level of operations and financial performance for the entity within operations objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires setting clear operational and financial goals.  Document these objectives to reflect desired performance.  Regularly monitor progress against these goals using key performance indicators (KPIs).  Analyze results, identify areas for improvement, and adjust your strategies.  This ensures your organization stays on track for success.

subcontrols.name: Forms a Basis for Committing of Resources - Management uses operations objectives as a basis for allocating resources needed to attain desired operations and financial performance.
subcontrols.description: Forms a Basis for Committing of Resources - Management uses operations objectives as a basis for allocating resources needed to attain desired operations and financial performance.
subcontrols.guidance: Align resource allocation with your organization's operational objectives. Define clear objectives for different departments and projects. Ensure resources like budget, personnel, and tools are assigned to support those objectives. Regularly review and adjust resource allocation based on performance and changing priorities. Document the rationale behind your resource allocation decisions.

subcontrols.name: Complies With Applicable Accounting Standards - Financial reporting objectives are consistent with accounting principles suitable and available for that entity. The accounting principles selected are appropriate in the circumstances.
subcontrols.description: Complies With Applicable Accounting Standards - Financial reporting objectives are consistent with accounting principles suitable and available for that entity. The accounting principles selected are appropriate in the circumstances.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your financial reporting adheres to a recognized accounting standard like GAAP or IFRS. This means your financial statements accurately reflect your financial performance and position.  The chosen accounting method should be suitable for your business and consistently applied.  Regularly review your accounting practices to maintain compliance.

subcontrols.name: Considers Materiality - Management considers materiality in financial statement presentation.
subcontrols.description: Considers Materiality - Management considers materiality in financial statement presentation.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes financial reporting accuracy. Management should establish thresholds for what constitutes a significant financial error or omission. They must then ensure processes are in place to identify, assess, and correct material misstatements before financial statements are finalized. This helps stakeholders make informed decisions.

subcontrols.name: Reflects Entity Activities - External reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events to show qualitative characteristics and assertions.
subcontrols.description: Reflects Entity Activities - External reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events to show qualitative characteristics and assertions.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control ensures accurate external reporting. Ensure your financial and operational reports accurately reflect your underlying activities. Use clear and consistent data to maintain the integrity of your reported information. Provide documentation and audit trails to demonstrate the accuracy and completeness of your reports. Regularly review and reconcile reports to ensure all transactions and events are properly reflected.

subcontrols.name: Complies With Externally Established Frameworks - Management establishes objectives consistent with laws and regulations or standards and frameworks of recognized external organizations.
subcontrols.description: Complies With Externally Established Frameworks - Management establishes objectives consistent with laws and regulations or standards and frameworks of recognized external organizations.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your organization adheres to all relevant legal, regulatory, and industry frameworks like ISO 27001 or NIST. Management must clearly define objectives aligned with these external standards. Document these objectives and how your practices meet the framework's requirements. Regularly review and update your compliance efforts to adapt to changes in the frameworks. This helps demonstrate commitment and minimize risks.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Required Level of Precision - Management reflects the required level of precision and accuracy suitable for user needs and based on criteria established by third parties in nonfinancial reporting.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Required Level of Precision - Management reflects the required level of precision and accuracy suitable for user needs and based on criteria established by third parties in nonfinancial reporting.
subcontrols.guidance: When selecting non-financial reporting metrics for SOC2 compliance, ensure the data's accuracy and precision match user expectations and any external standards.  Choose reporting methodologies and systems carefully to deliver appropriate levels of detail. Evaluate and document your rationale for the chosen precision level. Regularly review the chosen level to ensure it remains suitable for stakeholders.

subcontrols.name: Reflects Entity Activities - External reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events within a range of acceptable limits.
subcontrols.description: Reflects Entity Activities - External reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events within a range of acceptable limits.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, ensure your external reports accurately represent your internal financial and operational data.  Establish and document clear policies and procedures for generating these reports.  Implement controls to verify data integrity and reconcile reports to source data.  Regularly review and reconcile reported information to identify and correct any discrepancies, adhering to accepted reporting practices.

subcontrols.name: Reflects Management's Choices - Internal reporting provides management with accurate and complete information regarding management's choices and information needed in managing the entity.
subcontrols.description: Reflects Management's Choices - Internal reporting provides management with accurate and complete information regarding management's choices and information needed in managing the entity.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires clear internal reports. Ensure reports accurately reflect management's decisions and the reasoning behind them. Provide complete information needed for effective oversight and decision-making. Regular review and updates to reporting formats are key. Transparency in reporting fosters trust and accountability.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Required Level of Precision - Management reflects the required level of precision and accuracy suitable for user needs in nonfinancial reporting objectives and materiality within financial reporting objectives.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Required Level of Precision - Management reflects the required level of precision and accuracy suitable for user needs in nonfinancial reporting objectives and materiality within financial reporting objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes aligning data precision with its purpose. Non-financial reports should be accurate enough to inform users, avoiding unnecessary detail. In financial reporting, adhere to materiality thresholds to ensure data is precise enough to impact decisions. Management must determine and document the appropriate precision levels for each reporting objective. Regularly review and adjust precision as user needs or objectives evolve.

subcontrols.name: Reflects Entity Activities - Internal reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events within a range of acceptable limits.
subcontrols.description: Reflects Entity Activities - Internal reporting reflects the underlying transactions and events within a range of acceptable limits.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure internal reports accurately and consistently represent your organization's activities. Regularly review report data for accuracy and identify any significant deviations from expected ranges. Establish clear policies and procedures for data entry and reporting. Validate the underlying transactions supporting reported data. Implement controls to promptly detect and correct any reporting errors.

subcontrols.name: Reflects External Laws and Regulations - Laws and regulations establish minimum standards of conduct, which the entity integrates into compliance objectives.
subcontrols.description: Reflects External Laws and Regulations - Laws and regulations establish minimum standards of conduct, which the entity integrates into compliance objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires you to identify and adhere to relevant laws and regulations.  Document these legal requirements and how they impact your organization's operations.  Establish compliance objectives based on these legal standards.  Ensure your policies, procedures, and practices demonstrate adherence to these external mandates. Regularly review and update your compliance efforts to reflect changes in the legal landscape.

subcontrols.name: Considers Tolerances for Risk - Management considers the acceptable levels of variation relative to the achievement of operations objectives.
subcontrols.description: Considers Tolerances for Risk - Management considers the acceptable levels of variation relative to the achievement of operations objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires defining acceptable risk variations.  Identify key operational objectives and quantify their acceptable deviation.  Establish documented tolerance levels for these deviations based on their potential impact.  Regularly review and update tolerances as business operations change.  Ensure deviations outside tolerance trigger appropriate management responses.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Sub-objectives to Support Objectives - Management identifies sub-objectives related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy to support the achievement of the entity's objectives related to reporting, operations, and compliance.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Sub-objectives to Support Objectives - Management identifies sub-objectives related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy to support the achievement of the entity's objectives related to reporting, operations, and compliance.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, your organization needs clearly defined sub-objectives tied to the five Trust Services Criteria (security, availability, etc.). These sub-objectives should specifically support your overall business goals for operations, reporting, and compliance. Document these connections, demonstrating how each security-related objective contributes to the achievement of your broader organizational goals. Regularly review and update these sub-objectives to stay relevant and effective.

name: COSO Principle 7: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.
description: COSO Principle 7: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

subcontrols.name: Includes Entity, Subsidiary, Division, Operating Unit, and Functional Levels - The entity identifies and assesses risk at the entity, subsidiary, division, operating unit, and functional levels relevant to the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Includes Entity, Subsidiary, Division, Operating Unit, and Functional Levels - The entity identifies and assesses risk at the entity, subsidiary, division, operating unit, and functional levels relevant to the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with this SOC2 control, your organization must comprehensively identify and assess risks across all levels. This means evaluating risks at the entity, subsidiary, division, operating unit, and functional areas. Document your risk assessments, including potential impacts and likelihood, at each level to demonstrate thoroughness. Regularly update these assessments to address evolving threats and changes within the organization. This ensures a consistent understanding of risk across all levels and helps you effectively manage those risks.

subcontrols.name: Analyzes Internal and External Factors - Risk identification considers both internal and external factors and their impact on the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.description: Analyzes Internal and External Factors - Risk identification considers both internal and external factors and their impact on the achievement of objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Identify potential risks by examining internal aspects (like employee training, system configurations) and external factors (such as market trends, vendor security). Analyze how these combined factors could hinder your organization's objectives. Document your risk assessment process and findings, detailing the identified risks and their potential impacts. This enables proactive mitigation planning and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the threat landscape.

subcontrols.name: Involves Appropriate Levels of Management - The entity puts into place effective risk assessment mechanisms that involve appropriate levels of management.
subcontrols.description: Involves Appropriate Levels of Management - The entity puts into place effective risk assessment mechanisms that involve appropriate levels of management.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure management at various levels actively participates in risk assessments. This includes identifying risks, evaluating their impact, and contributing to mitigation strategies. Documentation should show this management involvement, such as meeting minutes and approval of risk responses. Regularly review and update the risk assessment process to adapt to changing business needs and demonstrate accountability. This involvement helps ensure relevant controls are implemented and maintained effectively.

subcontrols.name: Estimates Significance of Risks Identified - Identified risks are analyzed through a process that includes estimating the potential significance of the risk.
subcontrols.description: Estimates Significance of Risks Identified - Identified risks are analyzed through a process that includes estimating the potential significance of the risk.
subcontrols.guidance: To fulfill this SOC2 control, your process must assess the impact of each identified risk. Consider the likelihood of the risk materializing and the potential consequences if it does. Document this analysis, providing evidence of how you determined the risk's significance (e.g., high, medium, low). This helps prioritize mitigation efforts and demonstrates a proactive approach to risk management.

subcontrols.name: Determines How to Respond to Risks - Risk assessment includes considering how the risk should be managed and whether to accept, avoid, reduce, or share the risk.
subcontrols.description: Determines How to Respond to Risks - Risk assessment includes considering how the risk should be managed and whether to accept, avoid, reduce, or share the risk.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with the SOC2 control, perform a thorough risk assessment, identifying potential threats.  For each identified risk, evaluate management strategies: accept, avoid, reduce, or share.  Document the chosen response and the rationale.  Regularly review and update your risk response plan.  This ensures your approach remains effective and aligns with your business's security posture.

subcontrols.name: Identifies and Assesses Criticality of Information Assets and Identifies Threats and Vulnerabilities - The entity's risk identification and assessment process includes (1) identifying information assets, including physical devices and systems, virtual devices, software, data and data flows, external information systems, and organizational roles; (2) assessing the criticality of those information assets; (3) identifying the threats to the assets from intentional (including malicious) and unintentional acts and environmental events; and (4) identifying the vulnerabilities of the identified assets.
subcontrols.description: Identifies and Assesses Criticality of Information Assets and Identifies Threats and Vulnerabilities - The entity's risk identification and assessment process includes (1) identifying information assets, including physical devices and systems, virtual devices, software, data and data flows, external information systems, and organizational roles; (2) assessing the criticality of those information assets; (3) identifying the threats to the assets from intentional (including malicious) and unintentional acts and environmental events; and (4) identifying the vulnerabilities of the identified assets.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with this SOC2 control, begin by cataloging all your information assets.  Next, determine the importance (criticality) of each asset to your business operations. Identify potential threats, both intentional and unintentional, that could harm these assets.  Finally, assess the vulnerabilities within each asset that threats could exploit.  This process should be documented and regularly reviewed.

subcontrols.name: Analyzes Threats and Vulnerabilities From Vendors, Business Partners, and Other Parties - The entity's risk assessment process includes the analysis of potential threats and vulnerabilities arising from vendors providing goods and services, as well as threats and vulnerabilities arising from business partners, customers, and others with access to the entity's information systems.
subcontrols.description: Analyzes Threats and Vulnerabilities From Vendors, Business Partners, and Other Parties - The entity's risk assessment process includes the analysis of potential threats and vulnerabilities arising from vendors providing goods and services, as well as threats and vulnerabilities arising from business partners, customers, and others with access to the entity's information systems.
subcontrols.guidance: Identify and assess potential threats and vulnerabilities associated with all third-party vendors and partners with access to your systems or data. Conduct due diligence, including security questionnaires and audits, to evaluate their security posture. Document your findings and risk assessments. Implement appropriate controls to mitigate identified risks, such as access restrictions or data encryption, based on the level of risk. Regularly review and update these assessments as vendor relationships and the threat landscape evolve.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Significance of the Risk - The entity's consideration of the potential significance of the identified risks includes (1) determining the criticality of identified assets in meeting objectives; (2) assessing the impact of identified threats and vulnerabilities in meeting objectives; (3) assessing the likelihood of identified threats; and (4) determining the risk associated with assets based on asset criticality, threat impact, and likelihood.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Significance of the Risk - The entity's consideration of the potential significance of the identified risks includes (1) determining the criticality of identified assets in meeting objectives; (2) assessing the impact of identified threats and vulnerabilities in meeting objectives; (3) assessing the likelihood of identified threats; and (4) determining the risk associated with assets based on asset criticality, threat impact, and likelihood.
subcontrols.guidance: When evaluating risks for SOC2, prioritize critical assets first. Assess how threats and vulnerabilities could impact your objectives, considering their potential likelihood.  Determine the overall risk by combining asset criticality, threat impact severity, and the probability of the threat occurring. This helps focus your security efforts effectively.

name: COSO Principle 8: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.
description: COSO Principle 8: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

subcontrols.name: Considers Various Types of Fraud - The assessment of fraud considers fraudulent reporting, possible loss of assets, and corruption resulting from the various ways that fraud and misconduct can occur.
subcontrols.description: Considers Various Types of Fraud - The assessment of fraud considers fraudulent reporting, possible loss of assets, and corruption resulting from the various ways that fraud and misconduct can occur.
subcontrols.guidance: To address this SOC2 control, thoroughly assess potential fraud risks across your organization. Identify vulnerabilities related to financial reporting, asset misappropriation, and corruption.  Document these risks and implement controls to mitigate them, including regular audits and employee training.  Ensure these fraud prevention measures are continuously reviewed and updated.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Incentives and Pressures - The assessment of fraud risks considers incentives and pressures.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Incentives and Pressures - The assessment of fraud risks considers incentives and pressures.
subcontrols.guidance: Identify potential motivations for malicious actions, like financial pressures or performance targets.  Review employee compensation structures and performance evaluation systems. Analyze any existing organizational pressure points, such as intense competition or tight deadlines. Evaluate how these incentives and pressures could lead to security breaches or fraud. Document your findings and mitigation plans.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Opportunities - The assessment of fraud risk considers opportunities for unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposal of assets, altering the entity's reporting records, or committing other inappropriate acts.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Opportunities - The assessment of fraud risk considers opportunities for unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposal of assets, altering the entity's reporting records, or committing other inappropriate acts.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, identify potential weaknesses in your systems and processes.  Analyze where assets (data, systems, funds) are vulnerable to unauthorized access or misuse.  Evaluate reporting systems for manipulation risks, considering both internal and external threats.  Document these opportunities for fraud and how they could be exploited.  Implement controls to mitigate these identified risks.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Attitudes and Rationalizations - The assessment of fraud risk considers how management and other personnel might engage in or justify inappropriate actions.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Attitudes and Rationalizations - The assessment of fraud risk considers how management and other personnel might engage in or justify inappropriate actions.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with the SOC2 control assessing attitudes and rationalizations, evaluate employee and management motivations. Look for indicators of potential fraud, such as pressure to meet goals or rationalize unethical behavior.  Conduct surveys, interviews, and observe behaviors to gauge ethical climate and potential risks. Address any identified vulnerabilities promptly through training or policy changes.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Risks Related to the Use of IT and Access to Information - The assessment of fraud risks includes consideration of threats and vulnerabilities that arise specifically from the use of IT and access to information.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Risks Related to the Use of IT and Access to Information - The assessment of fraud risks includes consideration of threats and vulnerabilities that arise specifically from the use of IT and access to information.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires you to identify IT-specific fraud risks. Assess vulnerabilities in your systems and access controls that could lead to data breaches or financial loss. Examples include unauthorized access, insider threats, and phishing attacks targeting sensitive information. Document these risks and plan mitigation strategies to address them, ensuring your security posture aligns with your business's unique IT landscape.

name: COSO Principle 9: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.
description: COSO Principle 9: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Changes in the External Environment - The risk identification process considers changes to the regulatory, economic, and physical environment in which the entity operates.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Changes in the External Environment - The risk identification process considers changes to the regulatory, economic, and physical environment in which the entity operates.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review and analyze shifts in regulations, economic trends, and the physical landscape.  This involves monitoring external sources for potential impacts on business operations and security.  Identify and document risks stemming from these environmental changes. Incorporate findings into the overall risk assessment and mitigation strategies.  Adapt security controls proactively to address emerging threats and vulnerabilities.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Changes in the Business Model - The entity considers the potential impacts of new business lines, dramatically altered compositions of existing business lines, acquired or divested business operations on the system of internal control, rapid growth, changing reliance on foreign geographies, and new technologies.
