subcontrols.description: Assesses Changes in the Business Model - The entity considers the potential impacts of new business lines, dramatically altered compositions of existing business lines, acquired or divested business operations on the system of internal control, rapid growth, changing reliance on foreign geographies, and new technologies.
subcontrols.guidance: To address business model changes for SOC2, proactively analyze how shifts in your operations, such as new services, acquisitions, or rapid expansion, could affect existing controls.  Identify new risks these changes introduce.  Implement and document new controls or modify existing ones to mitigate identified risks.  Regularly review and update these controls as the business evolves.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Changes in Leadership - The entity considers changes in management and respective attitudes and philosophies on the system of internal control.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Changes in Leadership - The entity considers changes in management and respective attitudes and philosophies on the system of internal control.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply, proactively monitor leadership changes. Analyze new leaders' stated priorities and assess their impact on existing control processes. Document any shifts in the control environment resulting from these changes. Update internal controls or policies as needed to align with new leadership's approach. Ensure all personnel are aware of and trained on any modifications.

subcontrols.name: Assess Changes in Systems and Technology - The risk identification process considers changes arising from changes in the entity's systems and changes in the technology environment.
subcontrols.description: Assess Changes in Systems and Technology - The risk identification process considers changes arising from changes in the entity's systems and changes in the technology environment.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, establish a formal process for evaluating all system and technology changes. This process should identify potential risks introduced by these changes, including those from evolving technology landscapes. Risk assessments should then inform the development and implementation of appropriate security controls. Finally, document the entire process, including assessments, decisions, and implemented safeguards.

subcontrols.name: Assess Changes in Vendor and Business Partner Relationships - The risk identification process considers changes in vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.description: Assess Changes in Vendor and Business Partner Relationships - The risk identification process considers changes in vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review your vendor and business partner relationships to identify any significant changes, such as mergers, acquisitions, or changes in services offered.  Evaluate the impact of these changes on your organization's security posture.  Document your assessment process and findings. Address any identified risks with appropriate mitigation strategies. This helps ensure ongoing security and compliance.

name: COSO Principle 16: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.
description: COSO Principle 16: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

subcontrols.name: Considers a Mix of Ongoing and Separate Evaluations - Management includes a balance of ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.description: Considers a Mix of Ongoing and Separate Evaluations - Management includes a balance of ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.guidance: To fulfill this SOC2 control, ensure you're constantly monitoring security practices alongside periodic, independent audits. Ongoing evaluations include regular reviews and vulnerability scans, while separate evaluations involve independent assessments like penetration tests. This mix provides a comprehensive view of your security posture, catching issues early and validating the effectiveness of your controls. Document both ongoing monitoring and separate evaluations, including findings and remediation steps.

subcontrols.name: Considers Rate of Change - Management considers the rate of change in business and business processes when selecting and developing ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.description: Considers Rate of Change - Management considers the rate of change in business and business processes when selecting and developing ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes the need for agility.  Assess the speed at which your business and processes evolve.  Factor in the rate of change during risk assessments and when designing security evaluations.  Adapt your control environment and evaluation frequency to address evolving threats and opportunities. Continuous monitoring and updates are key.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Baseline Understanding - The design and current state of an internal control system are used to establish a baseline for ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Baseline Understanding - The design and current state of an internal control system are used to establish a baseline for ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.guidance: To establish a baseline, first, document your current control environment's design and operation. This involves detailing existing policies, procedures, and technologies. Use this documentation as a reference point. Conduct a formal evaluation to determine the current effectiveness. This baseline allows you to measure future improvements and track changes over time.

subcontrols.name: Uses Knowledgeable Personnel - Evaluators performing ongoing and separate evaluations have sufficient knowledge to understand what is being evaluated.
subcontrols.description: Uses Knowledgeable Personnel - Evaluators performing ongoing and separate evaluations have sufficient knowledge to understand what is being evaluated.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure evaluators possess the technical expertise necessary to understand the systems and processes under review. Verify their qualifications through documented training, certifications, and experience. Provide ongoing training to keep their knowledge current with evolving technologies and threats. Clearly define the scope of their responsibilities and expected level of understanding. Regularly assess their performance to confirm their competency in the evaluation process.

subcontrols.name: Integrates With Business Processes - Ongoing evaluations are built into the business processes and adjust to changing conditions.
subcontrols.description: Integrates With Business Processes - Ongoing evaluations are built into the business processes and adjust to changing conditions.
subcontrols.guidance: Continuously assess business processes for relevant SOC2 controls.  Integrate security reviews into routine operational tasks.  Adapt processes as the business evolves and threats change. Document all evaluations and adjustments. Ensure ongoing alignment of security practices with business needs.

subcontrols.name: Adjusts Scope and Frequency - Management varies the scope and frequency of separate evaluations depending on risk.
subcontrols.description: Adjusts Scope and Frequency - Management varies the scope and frequency of separate evaluations depending on risk.
subcontrols.guidance: Prioritize security assessments based on changing risks.  Increase the scope and frequency when threats escalate or key systems change.  Reduce assessment effort for lower-risk areas or stable controls. Document rationale for scope/frequency adjustments. This ensures efficient resource allocation and a proactive security posture.

subcontrols.name: Objectively Evaluates - Separate evaluations are performed periodically to provide objective feedback.
subcontrols.description: Objectively Evaluates - Separate evaluations are performed periodically to provide objective feedback.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly assess processes and systems with an unbiased approach. Conduct evaluations at predetermined intervals, ideally using a formal methodology. The goal is to identify areas needing improvement by providing constructive feedback. This ensures continuous monitoring and helps strengthen security posture. Document findings and track progress towards remediation.

subcontrols.name: Considers Different Types of Ongoing and Separate Evaluations - Management uses a variety of different types of ongoing and separate evaluations, including penetration testing, independent certification made against established specifications (for example, ISO certifications), and internal audit assessments.
subcontrols.description: Considers Different Types of Ongoing and Separate Evaluations - Management uses a variety of different types of ongoing and separate evaluations, including penetration testing, independent certification made against established specifications (for example, ISO certifications), and internal audit assessments.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, your organization must conduct various assessments. This includes continuous evaluations like internal audits and vulnerability scans, and independent assessments such as penetration tests and certifications like ISO. Ensure you document the scope, results, and remediation steps for all evaluations. These diverse evaluations provide a robust check on your security posture and help identify weaknesses.

name: COSO Principle 17: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action, including senior management and the board of directors, as appropriate.
description: COSO Principle 17: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action, including senior management and the board of directors, as appropriate.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Results - Management and the board of directors, as appropriate, assess results of ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Results - Management and the board of directors, as appropriate, assess results of ongoing and separate evaluations.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes management's review of evaluation findings. They must analyze the outcomes from ongoing and independent assessments of your security practices. This analysis helps identify vulnerabilities, track progress toward objectives, and ensure accountability for improvements. Management and the board use these results to make informed decisions and drive necessary changes. Document these assessments and decisions for audit purposes.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Deficiencies - Deficiencies are communicated to parties responsible for taking corrective action and to senior management and the board of directors, as appropriate.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Deficiencies - Deficiencies are communicated to parties responsible for taking corrective action and to senior management and the board of directors, as appropriate.
subcontrols.guidance: To address deficiencies, immediately inform those responsible for fixing them.  Escalate significant issues to senior management and the board, ensuring they understand the impact.  Documentation of the communication process, including recipients and dates, is critical.  Regularly track the status of remediation efforts and report progress. This ensures accountability and informed decision-making to mitigate risks.

subcontrols.name: Monitors Corrective Action - Management tracks whether deficiencies are remedied on a timely basis.
subcontrols.description: Monitors Corrective Action - Management tracks whether deficiencies are remedied on a timely basis.
subcontrols.guidance: To address SOC2's "Monitors Corrective Action," establish a clear process for tracking and resolving identified deficiencies. Implement a system for documenting each issue, assigned owner, and target resolution date. Regularly review progress against these targets to ensure timely remediation. Escalate unresolved deficiencies to management for awareness and intervention.

name: COSO Principle 10: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.
description: COSO Principle 10: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

subcontrols.name: Integrates With Risk Assessment - Control activities help ensure that risk responses that address and mitigate risks are carried out.
subcontrols.description: Integrates With Risk Assessment - Control activities help ensure that risk responses that address and mitigate risks are carried out.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control demands a direct link between your risk assessments and your security practices.  Ensure your controls are designed to address the specific risks identified in your risk assessment. Regularly review and update your controls based on changes to your risk profile. Document the rationale behind control implementation and how it mitigates identified risks. This creates a closed-loop system, showing how you manage risk.

subcontrols.name: Considers Entity-Specific Factors - Management considers how the environment, complexity, nature, and scope of its operations, as well as the specific characteristics of its organization, affect the selection and development of control activities.
subcontrols.description: Considers Entity-Specific Factors - Management considers how the environment, complexity, nature, and scope of its operations, as well as the specific characteristics of its organization, affect the selection and development of control activities.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, your company must tailor security measures to its unique circumstances.  Assess your specific risks considering your industry, size, and data sensitivity. Document how these factors influence the design and implementation of your security controls.  Regularly review and adjust your controls as your organization evolves.  This ensures effective security aligned with your operational realities.

subcontrols.name: Determines Relevant Business Processes - Management determines which relevant business processes require control activities.
subcontrols.description: Determines Relevant Business Processes - Management determines which relevant business processes require control activities.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, management must identify all business processes critical to your services. These processes should be documented. Evaluate each process's impact on security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy. The goal is to understand where control activities are most needed to protect your data and services. This assessment informs the design of your SOC2 controls.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates a Mix of Control Activity Types - Control activities include a range and variety of controls and may include a balance of approaches to mitigate risks, considering both manual and automated controls, and preventive and detective controls.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates a Mix of Control Activity Types - Control activities include a range and variety of controls and may include a balance of approaches to mitigate risks, considering both manual and automated controls, and preventive and detective controls.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your SOC2 controls are diverse, utilizing both manual and automated methods. Implement a mix of preventive controls (stopping issues) and detective controls (identifying issues). This balanced approach strengthens your security posture. Regularly review and adjust your control mix as your environment evolves.

subcontrols.name: Considers at What Level Activities Are Applied - Management considers control activities at various levels in the entity.
subcontrols.description: Considers at What Level Activities Are Applied - Management considers control activities at various levels in the entity.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control emphasizes a layered approach to security. Management should implement controls across different organizational levels, from high-level strategic decisions to day-to-day operational tasks. This ensures comprehensive coverage and reduces risks at all points. Regularly review and adjust controls as the organization grows and evolves.

subcontrols.name: Addresses Segregation of Duties - Management segregates incompatible duties, and where such segregation is not practical, management selects and develops alternative control activities.
subcontrols.description: Addresses Segregation of Duties - Management segregates incompatible duties, and where such segregation is not practical, management selects and develops alternative control activities.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure no single person has complete control over critical processes like financial transactions or data access. Identify conflicting roles that could lead to errors or fraud. Implement a system to separate these duties. If separation isn't possible, use compensating controls like extra reviews or approvals. Regularly review your segregation of duties and related controls to ensure effectiveness.

name: COSO Principle 11: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.
description: COSO Principle 11: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

subcontrols.name: Determines Dependency Between the Use of Technology in Business Processes and Technology General Controls - Management understands and determines the dependency and linkage between business processes, automated control activities, and technology general controls.
subcontrols.description: Determines Dependency Between the Use of Technology in Business Processes and Technology General Controls - Management understands and determines the dependency and linkage between business processes, automated control activities, and technology general controls.
subcontrols.guidance: Map your critical business processes to the technology they rely on. Identify the automated control activities within those processes. Then, pinpoint the specific technology general controls (like access control or change management) that support those automated controls.  This ensures management understands the interdependencies and the potential impact of technology failures on business operations. Regularly review these dependencies for changes.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Relevant Technology Infrastructure Control Activities - Management selects and develops control activities over the technology infrastructure, which are designed and implemented to help ensure the completeness, accuracy, and availability of technology processing.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Relevant Technology Infrastructure Control Activities - Management selects and develops control activities over the technology infrastructure, which are designed and implemented to help ensure the completeness, accuracy, and availability of technology processing.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires strong IT infrastructure management.  Focus on documenting and implementing control activities like access controls, change management, and data backup/recovery.  Ensure these activities are regularly tested and monitored to guarantee accuracy and availability.  Management's involvement in selecting and overseeing these activities is crucial.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Relevant Security Management Process Controls Activities - Management selects and develops control activities that are designed and implemented to restrict technology access rights to authorized users commensurate with their job responsibilities and to protect the entity's assets from external threats.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Relevant Security Management Process Controls Activities - Management selects and develops control activities that are designed and implemented to restrict technology access rights to authorized users commensurate with their job responsibilities and to protect the entity's assets from external threats.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement access controls based on the principle of least privilege. Regularly review and update user access rights to ensure they align with job responsibilities. Protect assets by implementing firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and other security measures.  These controls should be documented and enforced to mitigate risks from unauthorized access and external threats.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Relevant Technology Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance Process Control Activities - Management selects and develops control activities over the acquisition, development, and maintenance of technology and its infrastructure to achieve management's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Relevant Technology Acquisition, Development, and Maintenance Process Control Activities - Management selects and develops control activities over the acquisition, development, and maintenance of technology and its infrastructure to achieve management's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, define a clear process for procuring, building, and maintaining technology. This includes assessing risks, selecting appropriate technologies, and implementing change management procedures. Document all stages, from initial need identification to deployment and ongoing support. Regularly review and update these processes to ensure effectiveness and alignment with your objectives.

name: COSO Principle 12: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and in procedures that put policies into action.
description: COSO Principle 12: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and in procedures that put policies into action.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Policies and Procedures to Support Deployment of Management ‘s Directives - Management establishes control activities that are built into business processes and employees' day-to-day activities through policies establishing what is expected and relevant procedures specifying actions.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Policies and Procedures to Support Deployment of Management ‘s Directives - Management establishes control activities that are built into business processes and employees' day-to-day activities through policies establishing what is expected and relevant procedures specifying actions.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, create clear, documented policies and procedures that translate management's directives into actionable steps. These should define employee responsibilities and the expected conduct within your organization. Ensure the policies and procedures are integrated into daily business processes and easily accessible to all relevant personnel. Regularly review and update these documents to remain effective and current.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Responsibility and Accountability for Executing Policies and Procedures - Management establishes responsibility and accountability for control activities with management (or other designated personnel) of the business unit or function in which the relevant risks reside.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Responsibility and Accountability for Executing Policies and Procedures - Management establishes responsibility and accountability for control activities with management (or other designated personnel) of the business unit or function in which the relevant risks reside.
subcontrols.guidance: To fulfill this SOC2 control, clearly define who is responsible for each policy and procedure. Assign accountability to specific individuals or teams within the relevant business units. Document these assignments and ensure they are understood and followed. Regularly review and update these assignments as needed, reflecting organizational changes. This ensures proper execution and mitigation of identified risks.

subcontrols.name: Performs in a Timely Manner - Responsible personnel perform control activities in a timely manner as defined by the policies and procedures.
subcontrols.description: Performs in a Timely Manner - Responsible personnel perform control activities in a timely manner as defined by the policies and procedures.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure timely execution, establish clear deadlines for all control activities. Monitor task completion against these deadlines and address any delays promptly. Document all control activities and their completion dates for auditability. Regular reviews of performance help identify and resolve potential bottlenecks. Communication and accountability are key to maintaining a timely control environment.

subcontrols.name: Takes Corrective Action - Responsible personnel investigate and act on matters identified as a result of executing control activities.
subcontrols.description: Takes Corrective Action - Responsible personnel investigate and act on matters identified as a result of executing control activities.
subcontrols.guidance: When a control activity reveals an issue, promptly investigate the root cause.  Document the investigation process and findings. Implement corrective actions to address the identified problem and prevent recurrence.  Confirm the effectiveness of these actions through re-testing.  Maintain records of all corrective actions taken.

subcontrols.name: Performs Using Competent Personnel - Competent personnel with sufficient authority perform control activities with diligence and continuing focus.
subcontrols.description: Performs Using Competent Personnel - Competent personnel with sufficient authority perform control activities with diligence and continuing focus.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure qualified individuals, with the right skills and authority, are assigned to perform and monitor SOC2 controls.  Provide adequate training and ongoing development opportunities to maintain competency.  Establish clear documentation outlining responsibilities and expectations for control activities. Regularly review and assess personnel performance related to their assigned control tasks.  Maintain a culture that emphasizes diligence, accuracy, and continuous improvement in control execution.

subcontrols.name: Reassesses Policies and Procedures - Management periodically reviews control activities to determine their continued relevance and refreshes them when necessary.
subcontrols.description: Reassesses Policies and Procedures - Management periodically reviews control activities to determine their continued relevance and refreshes them when necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review all SOC2 policies and procedures to ensure they remain effective.  Document these reviews, including findings and any necessary updates.  Frequency should be based on risk, industry changes, and any identified vulnerabilities.  Revise policies and procedures promptly based on review outcomes. This process ensures controls adapt to evolving threats and business needs.

name: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Identifies and Manages the Inventory of Information Assets - The entity identifies, inventories, classifies, and manages information assets.
subcontrols.description: Identifies and Manages the Inventory of Information Assets - The entity identifies, inventories, classifies, and manages information assets.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, you need a clear, up-to-date list of all your company's data and systems.  This inventory should classify assets by sensitivity (e.g., public, confidential).  Regularly review and update this inventory as your organization and data landscape evolve.  Implement proper access controls and security measures based on these classifications to protect your assets.

subcontrols.name: Restricts  Logical Access - Logical access to information assets, including hardware, data (at-rest, during processing, or in transmission), software, administrative authorities, mobile devices, output, and offline system components is restricted through the use of access control software and rule sets.
subcontrols.description: Restricts  Logical Access - Logical access to information assets, including hardware, data (at-rest, during processing, or in transmission), software, administrative authorities, mobile devices, output, and offline system components is restricted through the use of access control software and rule sets.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement strong access controls using software and rules. Limit access to data, hardware, and software based on need-to-know. Regularly review and update these controls. Include mobile devices and offline components. Ensure proper authentication and authorization.

subcontrols.name: Identifies and Authenticates Users - Persons, infrastructure and software are identified and authenticated prior to accessing information assets, whether locally or remotely.
subcontrols.description: Identifies and Authenticates Users - Persons, infrastructure and software are identified and authenticated prior to accessing information assets, whether locally or remotely.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, establish strong user identification and authentication practices. Implement unique usernames and robust password policies for all users, including infrastructure and software. Utilize multi-factor authentication (MFA) wherever possible for added security. Regularly review and remove access for terminated employees. Audit access logs to monitor for unauthorized activity.

subcontrols.name: Considers Network Segmentation - Network segmentation permits unrelated portions of the entity's information system to be isolated from each other.
subcontrols.description: Considers Network Segmentation - Network segmentation permits unrelated portions of the entity's information system to be isolated from each other.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement network segmentation to isolate sensitive data and systems. Divide your network into logical zones based on function and security needs. This limits the impact of potential breaches by restricting lateral movement. Regularly review and update segmentation policies as your infrastructure evolves. Proper segmentation strengthens overall security posture and compliance.

subcontrols.name: Manages Points of Access - Points of access by outside entities and the types of data that flow through the points of access are identified, inventoried, and managed. The types of individuals and systems using each point of access are identified, documented, and managed.
subcontrols.description: Manages Points of Access - Points of access by outside entities and the types of data that flow through the points of access are identified, inventoried, and managed. The types of individuals and systems using each point of access are identified, documented, and managed.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, first inventory all external access points and the data they transmit. Next, document who (individuals and systems) uses each access point.  Implement access controls, such as least privilege, and regularly review and update the inventory and access rights.  This ensures only authorized users access necessary data via secure channels.

subcontrols.name: Restricts Access to Information Assets - Combinations of data classification, separate data structures, port restrictions, access protocol restrictions, user identification, and digital certificates are used to establish access control rules for information assets.
subcontrols.description: Restricts Access to Information Assets - Combinations of data classification, separate data structures, port restrictions, access protocol restrictions, user identification, and digital certificates are used to establish access control rules for information assets.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement strong access control by classifying data sensitivity.  Utilize separate data structures and restrict ports/protocols to limit access.  Enforce user identification and authentication via digital certificates. These measures ensure only authorized users and systems can access sensitive information.  Regularly review and update access controls.

subcontrols.name: Manages Identification and Authentication - Identification and authentication requirements are established, documented, and managed for individuals and systems accessing entity information, infrastructure and software.
subcontrols.description: Manages Identification and Authentication - Identification and authentication requirements are established, documented, and managed for individuals and systems accessing entity information, infrastructure and software.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear identification and authentication policies, documenting them thoroughly. Implement strong authentication methods like multi-factor authentication (MFA). Regularly review and update these policies and procedures. Ensure proper access controls are in place and enforced for all users and systems. Monitor authentication attempts and logs for anomalies.

subcontrols.name: Manages Credentials for Infrastructure and Software - New internal and external infrastructure and software  are registered, authorized, and documented prior to being granted access credentials and implemented on the network or access point. Credentials are removed and access is disabled when access is no longer required or the infrastructure and software are no longer in use.
subcontrols.description: Manages Credentials for Infrastructure and Software - New internal and external infrastructure and software  are registered, authorized, and documented prior to being granted access credentials and implemented on the network or access point. Credentials are removed and access is disabled when access is no longer required or the infrastructure and software are no longer in use.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure new infrastructure and software have documented approvals before receiving credentials.  Maintain a centralized system for managing and authorizing user access tied to these resources.  Regularly review access rights and promptly remove credentials when access isn't needed.  Document credential management processes, including provisioning and deprovisioning. This minimizes security risks and complies with the control.

subcontrols.name: Uses Encryption to Protect Data - The entity uses encryption to supplement other measures used to protect data-at-rest, when such protections are deemed appropriate based on assessed risk.
subcontrols.description: Uses Encryption to Protect Data - The entity uses encryption to supplement other measures used to protect data-at-rest, when such protections are deemed appropriate based on assessed risk.
subcontrols.guidance: Assess the risk of data breaches to determine where encryption is necessary for data-at-rest. Implement encryption for sensitive data based on this risk assessment, supplementing existing security measures.  Utilize strong encryption algorithms and key management practices. Regularly review encryption effectiveness and adjust as needed to address evolving threats. Ensure proper documentation of the encryption process and associated policies.

subcontrols.name: Protects Encryption Keys - Processes are in place to protect encryption keys during generation, storage, use, and destruction.
subcontrols.description: Protects Encryption Keys - Processes are in place to protect encryption keys during generation, storage, use, and destruction.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish and document procedures for managing encryption keys. Securely generate, store, and use keys, restricting access. Implement key rotation policies to mitigate risks. Destroy keys securely when no longer needed. Regularly audit key management practices.

name: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new internal and external users whose access is administered by the entity. For those users whose access is administered by the entity, user system credentials are removed when user access is no longer authorized.
description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new internal and external users whose access is administered by the entity. For those users whose access is administered by the entity, user system credentials are removed when user access is no longer authorized.

subcontrols.name: Controls Access Credentials to Protected Assets - Information asset access credentials are created based on an authorization from the system's asset owner or authorized custodian.
subcontrols.description: Controls Access Credentials to Protected Assets - Information asset access credentials are created based on an authorization from the system's asset owner or authorized custodian.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all access credentials to protected assets are only created after receiving explicit authorization. The authorization should come directly from the asset owner or a designated custodian.  Document the authorization process for each credential creation. Implement strong password and multi-factor authentication policies. Regularly review and revoke unnecessary access.

subcontrols.name: Removes Access to Protected Assets When Appropriate - Processes are in place to remove credential access when an individual no longer requires such access.
subcontrols.description: Removes Access to Protected Assets When Appropriate - Processes are in place to remove credential access when an individual no longer requires such access.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review user access to systems and data. Immediately revoke access for departing employees or those with changed roles. Utilize automated de-provisioning tools to streamline the removal process. Document all access removal actions. Ensure access removal aligns with your organization's security policies.

subcontrols.name: Reviews Appropriateness of Access Credentials - The appropriateness of access credentials is reviewed on a periodic basis for unnecessary and inappropriate individuals with credentials.
subcontrols.description: Reviews Appropriateness of Access Credentials - The appropriateness of access credentials is reviewed on a periodic basis for unnecessary and inappropriate individuals with credentials.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review user access rights to ensure they align with current job roles and responsibilities.  Remove or modify access for employees who have changed roles, are no longer employed, or whose access is deemed unnecessary.  Document the review process, including dates and findings.  This minimizes security risks associated with unauthorized access. Implement a system to flag or alert when access rights seem inappropriate.

name: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design and changes, giving consideration to the concepts of least privilege and segregation of duties, to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design and changes, giving consideration to the concepts of least privilege and segregation of duties, to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Creates or Modifies Access to Protected Information Assets - Processes are in place to create or modify access to protected information assets based on authorization  from the asset's owner.
subcontrols.description: Creates or Modifies Access to Protected Information Assets - Processes are in place to create or modify access to protected information assets based on authorization  from the asset's owner.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a formal access request process requiring authorization from the data owner before granting or modifying access to sensitive information. This process should document the request, approval, and the specific permissions granted. Regularly review and revoke access when employees change roles or leave the organization. Ensure segregation of duties to prevent conflicts of interest in access management. This practice helps maintain data security and compliance.

subcontrols.name: Removes Access to Protected Information Assets - Processes are in place to remove access to protected information assets when an individual no longer requires access.
subcontrols.description: Removes Access to Protected Information Assets - Processes are in place to remove access to protected information assets when an individual no longer requires access.
subcontrols.guidance: Immediately revoke access rights upon employee termination, role changes, or project completion. Regularly review access permissions to ensure they align with current job functions and needs. Implement automated processes to streamline access removal. Document all access removal actions, including date, time, and justification. Ensure compliance by monitoring and auditing access control effectiveness.

subcontrols.name: Uses Role-Based Access Controls - Role-based access control is utilized to support segregation of incompatible functions.
subcontrols.description: Uses Role-Based Access Controls - Role-based access control is utilized to support segregation of incompatible functions.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a role-based access control (RBAC) system. Define distinct roles with specific permissions. Segregate sensitive functions, ensuring no single role has conflicting access. Regularly review and update roles and permissions. This minimizes risk by controlling who can access what.

name: The entity restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets (for example, data center facilities,  back-up media storage, and other sensitive locations) to authorized personnel to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets (for example, data center facilities,  back-up media storage, and other sensitive locations) to authorized personnel to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Creates or Modifies Physical Access - Processes are in place to create or modify physical access to facilities such as data centers, office spaces, and work areas, based on authorization from the system's asset owner.
subcontrols.description: Creates or Modifies Physical Access - Processes are in place to create or modify physical access to facilities such as data centers, office spaces, and work areas, based on authorization from the system's asset owner.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a formal process for requesting and approving physical access changes. This includes clearly defining authorization levels and roles. Document all access modifications, including the rationale and approval trail. Regularly review and revoke access as needed, especially upon personnel changes. Ensure physical security measures align with access control policies.

subcontrols.name: Removes Physical Access - Processes are in place to remove access to physical resources when an individual no longer requires access.
subcontrols.description: Removes Physical Access - Processes are in place to remove access to physical resources when an individual no longer requires access.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, establish clear procedures for revoking physical access. This includes promptly removing keycards, badges, and other access methods when employees or contractors depart or their roles change. Regularly audit physical access logs and review access permissions to ensure accuracy and compliance with your documented processes. Ensure secure disposal of old access badges to prevent misuse. Finally, document all access removal actions.

subcontrols.name: Reviews Physical Access - Processes are in place to periodically review physical access to ensure consistency with job responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Reviews Physical Access - Processes are in place to periodically review physical access to ensure consistency with job responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly audit who has physical access (e.g., badge access, keys) to sensitive areas. Compare access privileges to current employee roles and responsibilities. Revoke access for terminated employees or those with changed roles promptly. Document these reviews, including findings and any necessary remediation steps. This ensures only authorized personnel can physically access your assets.

name: The entity discontinues logical and physical protections over physical assets only after the ability to read or recover data and software from those assets has been diminished and is no longer required to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity discontinues logical and physical protections over physical assets only after the ability to read or recover data and software from those assets has been diminished and is no longer required to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Data and Software for Disposal - Procedures are in place to identify data and software stored on equipment to be disposed and to render such data and software unreadable.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Data and Software for Disposal - Procedures are in place to identify data and software stored on equipment to be disposed and to render such data and software unreadable.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with this SOC2 control, establish a process for identifying all data and software residing on equipment slated for disposal.  Document these assets and implement secure data destruction methods.  This ensures confidential information is irretrievable before disposal.  Verify data sanitization through documented verification.  Ensure policy compliance through regular audits and training.

subcontrols.name: Removes Data and Software From Entity Control - Procedures are in place to remove data and software stored on equipment to be removed from the physical control of the entity and to render such data and software unreadable.
subcontrols.description: Removes Data and Software From Entity Control - Procedures are in place to remove data and software stored on equipment to be removed from the physical control of the entity and to render such data and software unreadable.
subcontrols.guidance: Before disposing of or transferring equipment, securely wipe all data and uninstall software.  Use approved data sanitization methods to ensure information is unrecoverable. Document the process, confirming that all data and software have been removed. This protects sensitive information and maintains compliance. These steps prevent data breaches when equipment leaves your organization's control.

name: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.
description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.

subcontrols.name: Restricts Access - The types of activities that can occur through a communication channel (for example, FTP site, router port) are restricted.
subcontrols.description: Restricts Access - The types of activities that can occur through a communication channel (for example, FTP site, router port) are restricted.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy the "Restricts Access" SOC2 control, limit the actions permitted over each communication channel. Configure your firewalls, routers, and services (like FTP) to allow only necessary protocols and ports. Implement least privilege principles, ensuring users and systems can only perform required tasks. Regularly review and update these restrictions as your environment changes. Doing so minimizes the attack surface and protects sensitive data.

subcontrols.name: Protects Identification and Authentication Credentials - Identification and authentication credentials are protected during transmission outside its system boundaries.
subcontrols.description: Protects Identification and Authentication Credentials - Identification and authentication credentials are protected during transmission outside its system boundaries.
subcontrols.guidance: Securely transmit credentials by encrypting data during transit, such as using TLS/SSL.  Never send credentials in plain text.  Implement robust key management practices.  Ensure protocols support strong authentication methods like multi-factor authentication (MFA).  Regularly review and update these security measures to address evolving threats.

subcontrols.name: Requires Additional Authentication or Credentials - Additional authentication information or credentials are required when accessing the system from outside its boundaries.
subcontrols.description: Requires Additional Authentication or Credentials - Additional authentication information or credentials are required when accessing the system from outside its boundaries.
subcontrols.guidance: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all remote access to your system.  Require strong passwords and consider implementing geo-fencing or IP whitelisting.  Regularly review and update access controls based on the evolving threat landscape.  This safeguards your data by verifying identities beyond the initial login. Properly documented procedures are key.

subcontrols.name: Implements Boundary Protection Systems - Boundary protection systems (for example, firewalls, demilitarized zones, and intrusion detection systems) are implemented to protect external access points from attempts and unauthorized access and are monitored to detect such attempts.
subcontrols.description: Implements Boundary Protection Systems - Boundary protection systems (for example, firewalls, demilitarized zones, and intrusion detection systems) are implemented to protect external access points from attempts and unauthorized access and are monitored to detect such attempts.
subcontrols.guidance: Protect your network perimeter with firewalls, DMZs, and intrusion detection systems.  These systems act as your first line of defense, blocking unauthorized access.  Continuously monitor these boundary protection tools for suspicious activity.  Regularly review and update your configurations to stay ahead of evolving threats.  Document your configurations and monitoring procedures.

name: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes, and protects it during transmission, movement, or removal to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes, and protects it during transmission, movement, or removal to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Restricts the Ability to Perform Transmission - Data loss prevention processes and technologies are used to restrict ability to authorize and execute transmission, movement and removal of information.
subcontrols.description: Restricts the Ability to Perform Transmission - Data loss prevention processes and technologies are used to restrict ability to authorize and execute transmission, movement and removal of information.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement data loss prevention (DLP) tools to monitor and control data movement.  Authorize and track all data transmissions. Enforce strict policies regarding data removal, preventing unauthorized exfiltration.  Regularly review DLP configurations and user access privileges.  Educate employees on secure data handling practices and consequences of violations.

subcontrols.name: Uses Encryption Technologies or Secure Communication Channels to Protect Data - Encryption technologies or secured communication channels are used to protect transmission of data and other communications beyond connectivity access points.
subcontrols.description: Uses Encryption Technologies or Secure Communication Channels to Protect Data - Encryption technologies or secured communication channels are used to protect transmission of data and other communications beyond connectivity access points.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, encrypt sensitive data during transit. Employ secure communication protocols like TLS/SSL for all external data transfers.  Use encryption to protect data shared internally if it contains sensitive information. Maintain and monitor your encryption key management practices. Regularly review and update your encryption methods to ensure they remain robust.

subcontrols.name: Protects Removal Media - Encryption technologies and physical asset protections are used for removable media (such as USB drives and back-up tapes), as appropriate.
subcontrols.description: Protects Removal Media - Encryption technologies and physical asset protections are used for removable media (such as USB drives and back-up tapes), as appropriate.
subcontrols.guidance: Secure removable media by encrypting sensitive data stored on them. Implement physical security, like locked storage, to protect the media.  Establish procedures for authorized use and disposal. Regularly audit and inventory removable media. This control safeguards against data breaches from lost or stolen media.

subcontrols.name: Protects Mobile Devices - Processes are in place to protect mobile devices (such as laptops, smart phones and tablets) that serve as information assets.
subcontrols.description: Protects Mobile Devices - Processes are in place to protect mobile devices (such as laptops, smart phones and tablets) that serve as information assets.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement mobile device management (MDM) to enforce security policies. Require strong passwords, encryption, and remote wipe capabilities. Regularly update software and operating systems on devices. Restrict access to sensitive data on personal devices. Educate employees on mobile security best practices.

name: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software to meet the entity's objectives.
description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software to meet the entity's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Restricts Application and Software Installation - The ability to install applications and software is restricted to authorized individuals.
subcontrols.description: Restricts Application and Software Installation - The ability to install applications and software is restricted to authorized individuals.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a formal process for software installation, requiring authorization and approval.  Use whitelisting or blacklisting to control what software can be installed on company devices. Log all software installation attempts and changes. Regularly review installed software to ensure compliance and remove unauthorized or outdated programs. Enforce these policies through technical controls like endpoint management.

subcontrols.name: Detects Unauthorized Changes to Software and Configuration Parameters - Processes are in place to detect changes to software and configuration parameters that may be indicative of unauthorized or malicious software.
subcontrols.description: Detects Unauthorized Changes to Software and Configuration Parameters - Processes are in place to detect changes to software and configuration parameters that may be indicative of unauthorized or malicious software.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, implement change detection mechanisms. Regularly scan systems for modifications to software and configuration files. Employ intrusion detection systems or file integrity monitoring tools. Establish alerts for unauthorized changes and investigate promptly. Document all changes and maintain a secure change management process.

subcontrols.name: Uses a Defined Change Control Process - A management-defined change control process is used for the implementation of software.
subcontrols.description: Uses a Defined Change Control Process - A management-defined change control process is used for the implementation of software.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all software changes, big or small, follow a documented process. This process should detail steps like requesting, testing, and approving changes. Implement version control for software, allowing for rollback if needed. Train relevant staff on the change control process. This helps maintain system integrity and prevents unintended consequences from software updates.

subcontrols.name: Uses Antivirus and Anti-Malware Software - Antivirus and anti-malware software is implemented and maintained to provide for the interception or detection and remediation of malware.
subcontrols.description: Uses Antivirus and Anti-Malware Software - Antivirus and anti-malware software is implemented and maintained to provide for the interception or detection and remediation of malware.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure robust antivirus/anti-malware software is deployed on all relevant systems. Regularly update these tools with the latest signatures and definitions. Implement scheduled scans and real-time monitoring.  Establish a clear process for investigating and remediating any detected malware incidents.  Document your configuration and results.

subcontrols.name: Scans Information Assets from Outside the Entity for Malware and Other Unauthorized Software - Procedures are in place to scan information assets that have been transferred or returned to the entity's custody for malware and other unauthorized software and to remove any items detected prior to its implementation on the network.
subcontrols.description: Scans Information Assets from Outside the Entity for Malware and Other Unauthorized Software - Procedures are in place to scan information assets that have been transferred or returned to the entity's custody for malware and other unauthorized software and to remove any items detected prior to its implementation on the network.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly scan all incoming and returned information assets for malware and unauthorized software. Implement automated scanning procedures to identify and quarantine threats. Document and remediate any detected malicious software before integrating assets into the network. Update scan engines frequently to ensure the latest threat detection. Maintain a log of all scans and identified threats for audit purposes.

name: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify (1) changes to configurations that result in the introduction of new vulnerabilities, and (2) susceptibilities to newly discovered vulnerabilities.
description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify (1) changes to configurations that result in the introduction of new vulnerabilities, and (2) susceptibilities to newly discovered vulnerabilities.

subcontrols.name: Uses Defined Configuration Standards - Management has defined configuration standards.
subcontrols.description: Uses Defined Configuration Standards - Management has defined configuration standards.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement documented configuration standards for all systems. Ensure these standards are consistently applied during initial setup and ongoing maintenance. Regularly review and update the standards to reflect evolving security threats and best practices. Enforce these standards through automated tools and manual reviews. This ensures consistent, secure configurations across your environment.

subcontrols.name: Monitors Infrastructure and Software - The entity monitors infrastructure and software for noncompliance with the standards, which could threaten the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Monitors Infrastructure and Software - The entity monitors infrastructure and software for noncompliance with the standards, which could threaten the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Continuously monitor infrastructure and software configurations against established security standards. Implement automated tools and alerts to detect deviations like unauthorized software or misconfigurations. Regularly review logs and system activities for anomalies indicating potential vulnerabilities or policy violations. Address identified noncompliance promptly through remediation efforts and documented change control. Document all monitoring activities, findings, and corrective actions.

subcontrols.name: Implements Change-Detection Mechanisms - The IT system includes a change-detection mechanism (for example, file integrity monitoring tools) to alert personnel to unauthorized modifications of critical system files, configuration files, or content files.
subcontrols.description: Implements Change-Detection Mechanisms - The IT system includes a change-detection mechanism (for example, file integrity monitoring tools) to alert personnel to unauthorized modifications of critical system files, configuration files, or content files.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, deploy file integrity monitoring (FIM) software.  Configure FIM to monitor key system files and configurations.  Set up alerts to notify designated personnel of any unauthorized changes detected. Regularly review and investigate these change alerts to identify potential security incidents. This proactive approach helps protect critical system components.

subcontrols.name: Detects Unknown or Unauthorized Components - Procedures are in place to detect the introduction of unknown or unauthorized components.
subcontrols.description: Detects Unknown or Unauthorized Components - Procedures are in place to detect the introduction of unknown or unauthorized components.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly inventory all hardware and software. Implement change management processes to track and approve new components. Employ vulnerability scanning and intrusion detection systems. Monitor system logs for suspicious activity.  These combined measures help identify unauthorized components.

subcontrols.name: Conducts Vulnerability Scans - The entity conducts vulnerability scans designed to identify potential vulnerabilities or misconfigurations on a periodic basis and after any significant change in the environment and takes action to remediate identified deficiencies on a timely basis.
subcontrols.description: Conducts Vulnerability Scans - The entity conducts vulnerability scans designed to identify potential vulnerabilities or misconfigurations on a periodic basis and after any significant change in the environment and takes action to remediate identified deficiencies on a timely basis.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly scan your systems and network for vulnerabilities. Schedule these scans periodically and after significant changes.  Analyze the scan results to identify any weaknesses.  Prioritize and promptly fix the identified vulnerabilities. Document the entire process, including scan dates and remediation efforts.

name: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies that are indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors affecting the entity's ability to meet its objectives; anomalies are analyzed to determine whether they represent security events.
description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies that are indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors affecting the entity's ability to meet its objectives; anomalies are analyzed to determine whether they represent security events.

subcontrols.name: Implements Detection Policies, Procedures, and Tools - Detection policies and procedures are defined and implemented, and detection tools are implemented on Infrastructure and software to identify anomalies in the operation or unusual activity on systems. Procedures may include (1) a defined governance process for security event detection and management that includes provision of resources; (2) use of intelligence sources to identify newly discovered threats and vulnerabilities; and (3) logging of unusual system activities.
subcontrols.description: Implements Detection Policies, Procedures, and Tools - Detection policies and procedures are defined and implemented, and detection tools are implemented on Infrastructure and software to identify anomalies in the operation or unusual activity on systems. Procedures may include (1) a defined governance process for security event detection and management that includes provision of resources; (2) use of intelligence sources to identify newly discovered threats and vulnerabilities; and (3) logging of unusual system activities.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, establish clear policies and procedures for detecting unusual system activity. Implement detection tools, like SIEMs, on your infrastructure and software to identify anomalies. Define a governance process with resource allocation for security event management. Utilize threat intelligence to stay ahead of new threats. Finally, ensure robust logging of suspicious activities for investigation.

subcontrols.name: Designs Detection Measures - Detection measures are designed to identify anomalies that could result from actual or attempted (1) compromise of physical barriers; (2) unauthorized actions of authorized personnel; (3) use of compromised identification and authentication credentials; (4) unauthorized access from outside the system boundaries; (5) compromise of authorized external parties; and (6) implementation or connection of unauthorized hardware and software.
subcontrols.description: Designs Detection Measures - Detection measures are designed to identify anomalies that could result from actual or attempted (1) compromise of physical barriers; (2) unauthorized actions of authorized personnel; (3) use of compromised identification and authentication credentials; (4) unauthorized access from outside the system boundaries; (5) compromise of authorized external parties; and (6) implementation or connection of unauthorized hardware and software.
subcontrols.guidance: Design detection measures to identify security anomalies stemming from diverse threats. These measures should cover physical barrier breaches, unauthorized actions, credential compromise, external access attempts, third-party risks, and unauthorized hardware/software. Implement a layered approach using various monitoring tools, like intrusion detection systems and audit logs. Regularly review and update these detection measures based on threat landscape changes.

subcontrols.name: Implements Filters to Analyze Anomalies - Management has implemented procedures to filter, summarize, and analyze anomalies to identify security events.
subcontrols.description: Implements Filters to Analyze Anomalies - Management has implemented procedures to filter, summarize, and analyze anomalies to identify security events.
subcontrols.guidance: To address this SOC2 control, establish automated filters to identify unusual activity in your systems. Regularly review and summarize filtered data to spot potential security incidents. Analyze these anomalies promptly to determine if they represent actual security events. Document your filtering procedures and analysis process. Finally, take swift action to address confirmed threats.

subcontrols.name: Monitors Detection Tools for Effective Operation - Management has implemented processes to monitor the effectiveness of detection tools.
subcontrols.description: Monitors Detection Tools for Effective Operation - Management has implemented processes to monitor the effectiveness of detection tools.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly check the functionality of all security detection tools (e.g., SIEM, IDS/IPS). Review logs, alerts, and reports to ensure tools are capturing relevant events. Analyze findings to identify and address any gaps in detection capabilities. Document monitoring activities and findings to demonstrate ongoing effectiveness.

name: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could or have resulted in a failure of the entity to meet its objectives (security incidents) and, if so, takes actions to prevent or address such failures.
description: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could or have resulted in a failure of the entity to meet its objectives (security incidents) and, if so, takes actions to prevent or address such failures.

subcontrols.name: Responds to Security Incidents - Procedures are in place for responding to security incidents and evaluating the effectiveness of those policies and procedures on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.description: Responds to Security Incidents - Procedures are in place for responding to security incidents and evaluating the effectiveness of those policies and procedures on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.guidance: Develop a documented incident response plan outlining steps for detection, containment, and recovery. Ensure all personnel understand their roles. Regularly test and update the plan through simulated exercises. Analyze incidents to identify root causes and improve procedures. Maintain a log of incidents and resolutions.

subcontrols.name: Communicates and Reviews Detected Security Events - Detected security events are communicated to and reviewed by the individuals responsible for the management of the security program and actions are taken, if necessary.
subcontrols.description: Communicates and Reviews Detected Security Events - Detected security events are communicated to and reviewed by the individuals responsible for the management of the security program and actions are taken, if necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all identified security incidents are promptly communicated to your security team. Regularly review these events to understand their impact and root cause. Implement defined procedures for investigating and responding to each event. Document all reviews, findings, and actions taken. This process ensures effective management and continuous improvement of your security posture.

subcontrols.name: Develops and Implements Procedures to Analyze Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to analyze security incidents and determine system impact.
subcontrols.description: Develops and Implements Procedures to Analyze Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to analyze security incidents and determine system impact.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet the SOC2 control, establish a clear process for analyzing security incidents. This should include steps to investigate, document, and assess the impact on systems and data. Define roles and responsibilities for incident handling and ensure timely response. Regularly review and improve the analysis procedures based on lessons learned. This will help minimize future impact.

subcontrols.name: Assesses the Impact on Personal Information - Detected security events are evaluated to determine whether they could or did result in the unauthorized disclosure or use of personal information and whether there has been a failure to comply with applicable laws or regulations.
subcontrols.description: Assesses the Impact on Personal Information - Detected security events are evaluated to determine whether they could or did result in the unauthorized disclosure or use of personal information and whether there has been a failure to comply with applicable laws or regulations.
subcontrols.guidance: When a security event occurs, immediately investigate if personal information was potentially compromised.  Determine if the event's nature, scope, and impact could lead to unauthorized disclosure or misuse of personal data.  Analyze if the event violates any relevant privacy laws or regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).  Document your findings and remediation efforts.  Escalate serious breaches promptly.

subcontrols.name: Determines Personal Information Used or Disclosed - When an unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information has occurred, the affected information is identified.
subcontrols.description: Determines Personal Information Used or Disclosed - When an unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information has occurred, the affected information is identified.
subcontrols.guidance: When unauthorized access or disclosure of personal information happens, immediately identify the specific data compromised.  Review logs, system access records, and any relevant documentation.  Determine the nature of the breach, the number of individuals impacted, and the type of personal information exposed.  This allows for proper incident response, notification, and remediation efforts.  Document your findings.

name: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents, as appropriate.
description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents, as appropriate.

subcontrols.name: Assigns Roles and Responsibilities - Roles and responsibilities for the design, implementation, maintenance, and execution of the incident response program are assigned, including the use of external resources when necessary.
subcontrols.description: Assigns Roles and Responsibilities - Roles and responsibilities for the design, implementation, maintenance, and execution of the incident response program are assigned, including the use of external resources when necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Define specific roles and responsibilities for your incident response program. Clearly document who is in charge of design, implementation, maintenance, and execution.  Include procedures for utilizing external experts or services, like forensic investigators. Ensure your team understands their responsibilities and has the necessary training.  This promotes a rapid and effective response to security incidents.

subcontrols.name: Contains Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to contain security incidents that actively threaten entity objectives.
subcontrols.description: Contains Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to contain security incidents that actively threaten entity objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Immediately isolate affected systems to prevent further damage. Document all actions taken and the scope of the breach. Notify relevant stakeholders, including legal and leadership, according to established protocols. Preserve evidence for investigation and analysis to determine the root cause. Implement remediation steps to address vulnerabilities and prevent recurrence.

subcontrols.name: Mitigates Ongoing Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to mitigate the effects of ongoing security incidents.
subcontrols.description: Mitigates Ongoing Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to mitigate the effects of ongoing security incidents.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear incident response procedures.  Define roles and responsibilities.  Implement containment and eradication steps to limit damage.  Communicate effectively with stakeholders during incidents.  Regularly test and update the plan for effectiveness.

subcontrols.name: Ends Threats Posed by Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to end the threats posed by security incidents through closure of the vulnerability, removal of unauthorized access, and other remediation actions.
subcontrols.description: Ends Threats Posed by Security Incidents - Procedures are in place to end the threats posed by security incidents through closure of the vulnerability, removal of unauthorized access, and other remediation actions.
subcontrols.guidance: To end threats from security incidents, establish clear procedures for remediation.  These should include steps to close vulnerabilities, immediately remove unauthorized access, and take all necessary actions.  Document all steps and outcomes for future analysis and improvement. Finally, verify the effectiveness of your remediation actions.

subcontrols.name: Restores Operations - Procedures are in place to restore data and business operations to an interim state that permits the achievement of entity objectives.
subcontrols.description: Restores Operations - Procedures are in place to restore data and business operations to an interim state that permits the achievement of entity objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure you have documented procedures to recover critical data and systems.  Regularly test these procedures, including backups and failover mechanisms.  Define roles and responsibilities for restoration efforts.  Maintain offsite backups and a disaster recovery plan.  Prioritize restoring essential functions to resume business operations.

subcontrols.name: Develops and Implements Communication Protocols for Security Incidents - Protocols for communicating security incidents and actions taken to affected parties are developed and implemented to meet the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Develops and Implements Communication Protocols for Security Incidents - Protocols for communicating security incidents and actions taken to affected parties are developed and implemented to meet the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear channels and methods for reporting and escalating security incidents.  Define who needs to be informed (internal teams, customers, regulators), and when.  Document communication procedures, including required content like incident details and remediation steps.  Conduct regular tests of these communication protocols to ensure effectiveness.  Review and update the protocols as needed.

subcontrols.name: Obtains Understanding of Nature of Incident and Determines Containment Strategy - An understanding of the nature (for example, the method by which the incident occurred and the affected system resources) and severity of the security incident is obtained to determine the appropriate containment strategy, including (1) a determination of the appropriate response time frame, and (2) the determination and execution of the containment approach.
