subcontrols.description: Obtains Understanding of Nature of Incident and Determines Containment Strategy - An understanding of the nature (for example, the method by which the incident occurred and the affected system resources) and severity of the security incident is obtained to determine the appropriate containment strategy, including (1) a determination of the appropriate response time frame, and (2) the determination and execution of the containment approach.
subcontrols.guidance: When a security incident occurs, immediately investigate to understand its method, scope, and severity. This knowledge guides your containment strategy, determining the urgency of your response.  Implement the plan, focusing on containing the incident within a defined timeframe to limit damage. Documentation of the entire process is crucial.

subcontrols.name: Remediates Identified Vulnerabilities - Identified vulnerabilities are remediated through the development and execution of remediation activities.
subcontrols.description: Remediates Identified Vulnerabilities - Identified vulnerabilities are remediated through the development and execution of remediation activities.
subcontrols.guidance: Prioritize and address identified vulnerabilities promptly. Develop a clear remediation plan, assigning responsibility and timelines. Execute the plan, applying patches, configuration changes, or other solutions. Verify remediation effectiveness through testing or re-scanning. Document all remediation efforts and results for audit trails.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Remediation Activities - Remediation activities are documented and communicated in accordance with the incident response program.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Remediation Activities - Remediation activities are documented and communicated in accordance with the incident response program.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all incident response efforts, including fixes and improvements, are thoroughly documented.  Communicate these remediation actions promptly and clearly to relevant stakeholders, such as your team, management, and possibly clients, depending on the incident.  This communication should align with your established incident response plan. Transparency builds trust and aids in preventing future occurrences. Document all communications as evidence.

subcontrols.name: Evaluates the Effectiveness of Incident Response - The design of incident response activities is evaluated for effectiveness on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.description: Evaluates the Effectiveness of Incident Response - The design of incident response activities is evaluated for effectiveness on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly assess your incident response plan's effectiveness through exercises and post-incident reviews. These evaluations should identify areas for improvement, such as response times, communication, and technical procedures. Analyze metrics like mean time to detect (MTTD) and mean time to resolve (MTTR) to gauge your plan's efficiency. Update your plan and training based on the evaluation findings to ensure continuous improvement. Document all evaluations, findings, and implemented changes.

subcontrols.name: Periodically Evaluates Incidents - Periodically, management reviews incidents related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy and identifies the need for system changes based on incident patterns and root causes.
subcontrols.description: Periodically Evaluates Incidents - Periodically, management reviews incidents related to security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy and identifies the need for system changes based on incident patterns and root causes.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly analyze past security incidents. Identify trends and root causes in incident data to spot weaknesses. Based on these findings, determine if system changes are necessary to prevent future occurrences. Document the review process and implemented changes. This helps improve security posture and prevent similar issues.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Unauthorized Use and Disclosure - Events that resulted in unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information are communicated to the data subjects, legal and regulatory authorities, and others as required.
subcontrols.description: Communicates Unauthorized Use and Disclosure - Events that resulted in unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information are communicated to the data subjects, legal and regulatory authorities, and others as required.
subcontrols.guidance: When personal data is misused, promptly notify affected individuals.  Report breaches to relevant legal and regulatory bodies.  Document the incident, outlining details of the unauthorized use or disclosure.  Provide clear and timely communication, outlining what happened, what's being done, and any impact on individuals.  Maintain thorough records of these communications.

subcontrols.name: Application of Sanctions - The conduct of individuals and organizations operating under the authority of the entity and involved in the unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information is evaluated and, if appropriate, sanctioned in accordance with entity policies and legal and regulatory requirements.
subcontrols.description: Application of Sanctions - The conduct of individuals and organizations operating under the authority of the entity and involved in the unauthorized use or disclosure of personal information is evaluated and, if appropriate, sanctioned in accordance with entity policies and legal and regulatory requirements.
subcontrols.guidance: Enforce a clear policy outlining consequences for data breaches or misuse of personal information. Investigate all incidents thoroughly to determine the extent of unauthorized actions. Apply sanctions consistently, proportionate to the severity of the violation, and aligned with your policy. Document all disciplinary actions taken. Ensure sanctions meet legal and regulatory obligations.

name: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.
description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

subcontrols.name: Restores the Affected Environment - The activities restore the affected environment to functional operation by rebuilding systems, updating software, installing patches, and changing configurations, as needed.
subcontrols.description: Restores the Affected Environment - The activities restore the affected environment to functional operation by rebuilding systems, updating software, installing patches, and changing configurations, as needed.
subcontrols.guidance: To restore a compromised environment, rebuild critical systems, focusing on secure configurations. Update all software and operating systems with the latest patches. Implement changes to configurations to reinforce security protocols. Document the restoration process and conduct thorough testing. Verify full functionality and data integrity before declaring the environment fully recovered.

subcontrols.name: Communicates Information About the Event - Communications about the nature of the incident, recovery actions taken, and activities required for the prevention of future security events are made to management and others as appropriate (internal and external).
subcontrols.description: Communicates Information About the Event - Communications about the nature of the incident, recovery actions taken, and activities required for the prevention of future security events are made to management and others as appropriate (internal and external).
subcontrols.guidance: Establish clear communication channels for security incidents. Notify relevant internal teams (management, IT) promptly with details of the event, including the nature of the incident and its impact. Document recovery steps taken and lessons learned.  Communicate externally to stakeholders as required by legal and contractual obligations.  Ensure ongoing communication about preventative measures to prevent future incidents.

subcontrols.name: Determines Root Cause of the Event - The root cause of the event is determined.
subcontrols.description: Determines Root Cause of the Event - The root cause of the event is determined.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, thoroughly investigate all security incidents.  Document the steps taken to identify the initial trigger and all contributing factors. Analyze logs, system configurations, and user actions to pinpoint the underlying cause.  Implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence based on the root cause analysis. This ensures effective problem resolution and improved security posture.

subcontrols.name: Implements Changes to Prevent and Detect Recurrences - Additional architecture or changes to preventive and detective controls, or both, are implemented to prevent and detect recurrences on a timely basis.
subcontrols.description: Implements Changes to Prevent and Detect Recurrences - Additional architecture or changes to preventive and detective controls, or both, are implemented to prevent and detect recurrences on a timely basis.
subcontrols.guidance: To address recurring issues, analyze the root cause of the original problem.  Implement lasting changes to your architecture or existing controls to prevent similar incidents.  These changes should proactively block the issue or detect it quickly if it does re-emerge. Document these changes and verify their effectiveness.  Regularly review and update your controls based on their performance.

subcontrols.name: Improves Response and Recovery Procedures - Lessons learned are analyzed, and the incident response plan and recovery procedures are improved.
subcontrols.description: Improves Response and Recovery Procedures - Lessons learned are analyzed, and the incident response plan and recovery procedures are improved.
subcontrols.guidance: To strengthen incident response, analyze all past incidents to identify areas for improvement. This analysis should inform updates to your incident response plan and recovery procedures. Regularly review and revise these plans based on new threats, vulnerabilities, and lessons learned. Practice your updated plans through exercises to ensure their effectiveness. Continuously refining these processes helps minimize impact and accelerate recovery.

subcontrols.name: Implements Incident Recovery Plan Testing - Incident recovery plan testing is performed on a periodic basis. The testing includes (1) development of testing scenarios based on threat likelihood and magnitude; (2) consideration of relevant system components from across the entity that can impair availability; (3) scenarios that consider the potential for the lack of availability of key personnel; and (4) revision of continuity plans and systems based on test results.
subcontrols.description: Implements Incident Recovery Plan Testing - Incident recovery plan testing is performed on a periodic basis. The testing includes (1) development of testing scenarios based on threat likelihood and magnitude; (2) consideration of relevant system components from across the entity that can impair availability; (3) scenarios that consider the potential for the lack of availability of key personnel; and (4) revision of continuity plans and systems based on test results.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly test your incident recovery plan using scenarios based on potential threats.  Include all critical systems and consider how personnel availability impacts recovery.  These tests should reveal weaknesses and inform updates to your recovery plans and systems. The goal is to ensure a swift and effective response. Update your plans based on testing results to improve resilience.

name: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures to meet its objectives.
description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures to meet its objectives.

subcontrols.name: Manages Changes Throughout the System Lifecycle - A process for managing system changes throughout the lifecycle of the system and its components (infrastructure, data, software and procedures) is used to support system availability and processing integrity.
subcontrols.description: Manages Changes Throughout the System Lifecycle - A process for managing system changes throughout the lifecycle of the system and its components (infrastructure, data, software and procedures) is used to support system availability and processing integrity.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a documented change management process.  Track all system changes, including infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.  Require approvals and testing before changes are implemented.  Maintain an audit trail of all changes for accountability and issue resolution.  This process ensures system stability and minimizes disruptions.

subcontrols.name: Authorizes Changes - A process is in place to authorize system changes prior to development.
subcontrols.description: Authorizes Changes - A process is in place to authorize system changes prior to development.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a formal change management process. Require documented authorization from relevant stakeholders (e.g., IT, business owners) before any system changes begin. This ensures alignment, minimizes risks, and prevents unauthorized modifications. Track approved changes for accountability. Finally, implement a rollback plan for any failed changes.

subcontrols.name: Designs and Develops Changes - A process is in place to design and develop system changes.
subcontrols.description: Designs and Develops Changes - A process is in place to design and develop system changes.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, establish a formal change management process. This process should include documentation, impact assessments, testing protocols, and approval workflows. Ensure proper authorization and version control for all system modifications. Finally, document all changes made, including who made them and when.

subcontrols.name: Documents Changes - A process is in place to document system changes to support ongoing maintenance of the system and to support system users in performing their responsibilities.
subcontrols.description: Documents Changes - A process is in place to document system changes to support ongoing maintenance of the system and to support system users in performing their responsibilities.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a formal change management process to document all system modifications. This includes the rationale, implementation details, and testing results for each change. Track these changes meticulously, creating an audit trail for future reference. Ensure documentation is readily accessible to both IT staff and relevant system users. Regularly review the process for effectiveness.

subcontrols.name: Tracks System Changes - A process is in place to track system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.description: Tracks System Changes - A process is in place to track system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a system to log all proposed system changes. This log should document the change request, affected systems, and planned implementation.  Ensure all changes are approved before deployment. After implementation, verify the change's success and update the log accordingly. Maintain an audit trail of all system modifications.

subcontrols.name: Configures Software - A process is in place to select and implement the configuration parameters used to control the functionality of software.
subcontrols.description: Configures Software - A process is in place to select and implement the configuration parameters used to control the functionality of software.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure a documented process exists for software configuration, covering selection, implementation, and regular review. This includes defining standard configurations, security settings, and operational parameters. Implement version control to track changes and maintain consistency across environments. Regularly audit configurations against established baselines and security requirements. Train relevant personnel on configuration procedures and best practices.

subcontrols.name: Tests System Changes - A process is in place to test system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.description: Tests System Changes - A process is in place to test system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure system stability, thoroughly test all changes before deploying them. This includes functional and performance testing based on documented requirements.  Document test results, including any identified issues and resolutions.  Obtain approvals demonstrating the changes met defined criteria.  Finally, incorporate test results into your change management process.

subcontrols.name: Approves System Changes - A process is in place to approve system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.description: Approves System Changes - A process is in place to approve system changes prior to implementation.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a formal change management process.  Require documented approval from designated personnel before any system modification.  Include risk assessments and impact analysis as part of the approval.  Track all approved changes, and maintain a record of approvals. Enforce the process to ensure all system changes are authorized.

subcontrols.name: Deploys System Changes - A process is in place to implement system changes.
subcontrols.description: Deploys System Changes - A process is in place to implement system changes.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a documented process for all system changes, outlining steps for planning, testing, and deployment. Require change requests with approvals from relevant stakeholders. Utilize version control and automated deployment tools where possible.  Maintain clear documentation and rollback plans for all changes.  Regularly review and audit the change management process.

subcontrols.name: Identifies and Evaluates System Changes - Objectives affected by system changes are identified, and the ability of the modified system to meet the objectives is evaluated throughout the system development life cycle.
subcontrols.description: Identifies and Evaluates System Changes - Objectives affected by system changes are identified, and the ability of the modified system to meet the objectives is evaluated throughout the system development life cycle.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure all system changes are documented, detailing their purpose and the systems impacted. Assess the potential impact of each change on your SOC 2 objectives (security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy). Thoroughly test changes before deployment to confirm they meet existing objectives and haven't introduced vulnerabilities. Maintain change management logs for auditing. This proactive approach minimizes risks associated with modifications.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Changes in Infrastructure, Data, Software, and Procedures Required to Remediate Incidents - Changes in infrastructure, data, software, and procedures required to remediate incidents to continue to meet objectives are identified, and the change process is initiated upon identification.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Changes in Infrastructure, Data, Software, and Procedures Required to Remediate Incidents - Changes in infrastructure, data, software, and procedures required to remediate incidents to continue to meet objectives are identified, and the change process is initiated upon identification.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control focuses on adapting to incident responses.  After an incident, determine what infrastructure, data, software, or procedural changes are needed to prevent recurrence.  Formally initiate a change process to implement these modifications.  This ensures the system remains secure and objectives are met even after a security event.

subcontrols.name: Creates Baseline Configuration of IT Technology - A baseline configuration of IT and control systems is created and maintained.
subcontrols.description: Creates Baseline Configuration of IT Technology - A baseline configuration of IT and control systems is created and maintained.
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a secure, documented baseline configuration for all IT systems and applications.  This includes hardware, software, and security settings. Regularly update this baseline to reflect necessary changes and security patches.  Use this baseline to detect and remediate deviations from your desired secure state. Maintaining the baseline is critical for consistent security and compliance.

subcontrols.name: Provides for Changes Necessary in Emergency Situations  - A process is in place for authorizing, designing, testing, approving and implementing changes necessary in emergency situations (that is, changes that need to be implemented in an urgent timeframe).
subcontrols.description: Provides for Changes Necessary in Emergency Situations  - A process is in place for authorizing, designing, testing, approving and implementing changes necessary in emergency situations (that is, changes that need to be implemented in an urgent timeframe).
subcontrols.guidance: Establish a rapid change management process specifically for emergencies. This process should include clear authorization procedures, streamlined design and testing, and expedited approval workflows. Document all emergency changes thoroughly, including the rationale for urgency and the impact assessment. Regularly review and refine the process based on past incidents.

subcontrols.name: Protects Confidential Information - The entity protects confidential information during system design, development, testing, implementation, and change processes to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
subcontrols.description: Protects Confidential Information - The entity protects confidential information during system design, development, testing, implementation, and change processes to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure confidential data is shielded throughout all software development stages. Implement access controls, encryption, and secure coding practices to prevent unauthorized disclosure. Conduct thorough testing to identify and address vulnerabilities before deployment. Carefully manage changes to systems containing sensitive data to maintain confidentiality. Document these procedures and regularly review them to adapt to evolving threats.

subcontrols.name: Protects Personal Information - The entity protects personal information during system design, development, testing, implementation, and change processes to meet the entity's objectives related to privacy.
subcontrols.description: Protects Personal Information - The entity protects personal information during system design, development, testing, implementation, and change processes to meet the entity's objectives related to privacy.
subcontrols.guidance: Safeguard personal information throughout the entire software lifecycle. Implement privacy-focused design principles from the outset. Rigorously test and validate privacy controls during development and changes. Ensure clear data handling practices and secure storage methods. Document all processes to demonstrate adherence to privacy objectives.

name: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.
description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

subcontrols.name: Considers Mitigation of Risks of Business Disruption - Risk mitigation activities include the development of planned policies, procedures, communications, and alternative processing solutions to respond to, mitigate, and recover from security events that disrupt business operations. Those policies and procedures include monitoring processes and information and communications to meet the entity's objectives during response, mitigation, and recovery efforts.
subcontrols.description: Considers Mitigation of Risks of Business Disruption - Risk mitigation activities include the development of planned policies, procedures, communications, and alternative processing solutions to respond to, mitigate, and recover from security events that disrupt business operations. Those policies and procedures include monitoring processes and information and communications to meet the entity's objectives during response, mitigation, and recovery efforts.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires proactive planning for business disruptions. Develop and document policies and procedures outlining your response, mitigation, and recovery strategies for security incidents.  Include detailed monitoring processes, communication plans, and alternative solutions to maintain business operations. Regularly test and update these plans to ensure effectiveness and meet your objectives.

subcontrols.name: Considers the Use of Insurance to Mitigate Financial Impact Risks - The risk management activities consider the use of insurance to offset the financial impact of loss events that would otherwise impair the ability of the entity to meet its objectives.
subcontrols.description: Considers the Use of Insurance to Mitigate Financial Impact Risks - The risk management activities consider the use of insurance to offset the financial impact of loss events that would otherwise impair the ability of the entity to meet its objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: This SOC2 control requires assessing potential financial risks and determining if insurance can lessen their impact.  Identify key loss events like data breaches or service disruptions. Explore available insurance policies that cover these events and their potential financial consequences. Document your decisions regarding insurance coverage and how it aligns with your business objectives.  Regularly review insurance policies to ensure they remain adequate.

name: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.
description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Requirements for Vendor and Business Partner Engagements - The entity establishes specific requirements for a vendor and business partner engagement that includes (1) scope of services and product specifications, (2) roles and responsibilities, (3) compliance requirements, and (4) service levels.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Requirements for Vendor and Business Partner Engagements - The entity establishes specific requirements for a vendor and business partner engagement that includes (1) scope of services and product specifications, (2) roles and responsibilities, (3) compliance requirements, and (4) service levels.
subcontrols.guidance: When engaging vendors, clearly define service scope, product specifications, and respective roles.  Outline compliance requirements, like security standards, that vendors must adhere to.  Establish measurable service level agreements (SLAs) to ensure performance.  Document these requirements in contracts or vendor agreements.  Regularly review vendor performance against these established parameters.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Vendor and Business Partner Risks - The entity assesses, on a periodic basis, the risks that vendors and business partners (and those entities' vendors and business partners) represent to the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Vendor and Business Partner Risks - The entity assesses, on a periodic basis, the risks that vendors and business partners (and those entities' vendors and business partners) represent to the achievement of the entity's objectives.
subcontrols.guidance: To address vendor risk, regularly evaluate vendors and their sub-vendors. Define risk criteria and assess vendors against them, focusing on data security and business impact. Document the assessment process, including identified risks and planned mitigation strategies. Implement a process for ongoing monitoring, including periodic reviews and reassessments. This ensures continued alignment with your organization's objectives.

subcontrols.name: Assigns Responsibility and Accountability for Managing Vendors and Business Partners - The entity assigns responsibility and accountability for the management of risks associated with vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.description: Assigns Responsibility and Accountability for Managing Vendors and Business Partners - The entity assigns responsibility and accountability for the management of risks associated with vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.guidance: Clearly define roles and responsibilities for vendor management. Establish who is accountable for vendor risk, onboarding, and ongoing monitoring. Implement a documented process for vendor selection, due diligence, and contract reviews. Ensure regular vendor performance evaluations and communication. This creates a system to mitigate risks associated with third-party relationships.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Communication Protocols for Vendors and Business Partners - The entity establishes communication and resolution protocols for service or product issues related to vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Communication Protocols for Vendors and Business Partners - The entity establishes communication and resolution protocols for service or product issues related to vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.guidance: Define clear communication channels (email, portal, etc.) for vendor interactions.  Document issue reporting and escalation paths. Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for response times. Ensure regular vendor performance reviews to identify and resolve recurring problems. Communicate protocols to both your team and the vendors.

subcontrols.name: Establishes Exception Handling Procedures From Vendors and Business Partners  - The entity establishes exception handling procedures for service or product issues related to vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.description: Establishes Exception Handling Procedures From Vendors and Business Partners  - The entity establishes exception handling procedures for service or product issues related to vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.guidance: To address vendor/business partner issues, define a clear exception handling process. This process should outline steps for reporting, investigating, and resolving service or product failures. Ensure roles and responsibilities are clearly defined. Document all exceptions and resolutions for tracking and future analysis. Finally, integrate the exception handling process into your overall vendor management program.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Vendor and Business Partner Performance - The entity periodically assesses the performance of vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Vendor and Business Partner Performance - The entity periodically assesses the performance of vendors and business partners.
subcontrols.guidance: To maintain SOC 2 compliance, regularly review your vendors and business partners. Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to security and data protection. Document assessments, including identified risks and any necessary remediation steps. Use these assessments to ensure ongoing vendor adherence to your security requirements. This helps mitigate risks and maintain trust.

subcontrols.name: Implements Procedures for Addressing Issues Identified During Vendor and Business Partner Assessments - The entity implements procedures for addressing issues identified with vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.description: Implements Procedures for Addressing Issues Identified During Vendor and Business Partner Assessments - The entity implements procedures for addressing issues identified with vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.guidance: Prioritize remediation of critical vulnerabilities found during vendor assessments. Establish clear communication channels for reporting and resolving identified issues. Track remediation progress and ensure timely resolution. Regularly review the effectiveness of implemented fixes. Document all actions taken for audit purposes.

subcontrols.name: Implements Procedures for Terminating Vendor and Business Partner Relationships  -  The entity implements procedures for terminating vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.description: Implements Procedures for Terminating Vendor and Business Partner Relationships  -  The entity implements procedures for terminating vendor and business partner relationships.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, establish a clear process for ending relationships with vendors and partners. This should include defined termination triggers, such as contract expiration or security breaches. Document the process for data retrieval or destruction, and ensure access is revoked promptly. Finally, maintain records of terminations for audit purposes.

subcontrols.name: Obtains Confidentiality Commitments from Vendors and Business Partners - The entity obtains confidentiality commitments that are consistent with the entity's confidentiality commitments and requirements from vendors and business partners who have access to confidential information.
subcontrols.description: Obtains Confidentiality Commitments from Vendors and Business Partners - The entity obtains confidentiality commitments that are consistent with the entity's confidentiality commitments and requirements from vendors and business partners who have access to confidential information.
subcontrols.guidance: To fulfill this SOC2 control, require vendors and partners with access to your confidential data to sign legally binding confidentiality agreements. These agreements should mirror your own data protection standards and clearly define the scope, responsibilities, and consequences of data breaches. Ensure these agreements are reviewed and updated regularly, and verify compliance through audits or questionnaires. Finally, maintain a centralized repository of all signed agreements.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Compliance With Confidentiality Commitments of Vendors and Business Partners  -  On a periodic and as-needed basis, the entity assesses compliance by vendors and business partners with the entity's confidentiality commitments and requirements.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Compliance With Confidentiality Commitments of Vendors and Business Partners  -  On a periodic and as-needed basis, the entity assesses compliance by vendors and business partners with the entity's confidentiality commitments and requirements.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure confidentiality, regularly review vendors and partners against your agreements.  This includes reviewing their security practices, policies, and any relevant audit reports.  Verify they understand and adhere to your data handling requirements. Document all assessments and any identified gaps.  Address any non-compliance promptly and escalate as necessary.

subcontrols.name: Obtains Privacy Commitments from Vendors and Business Partners - The entity obtains privacy commitments, consistent with the entity's privacy commitments and requirements, from vendors and business partners who have access to personal information.
subcontrols.description: Obtains Privacy Commitments from Vendors and Business Partners - The entity obtains privacy commitments, consistent with the entity's privacy commitments and requirements, from vendors and business partners who have access to personal information.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure vendors and partners handling personal data agree to your privacy standards. This involves reviewing contracts to include privacy clauses. Document these commitments and assess compliance. Implement a process to monitor their adherence. This protects sensitive information and meets regulatory needs.

subcontrols.name: Assesses Compliance with Privacy Commitments of Vendors and Business Partners -  On a periodic and as-needed basis, the entity assesses compliance by vendors and business partners with the entity's privacy commitments and requirements and takes corrective action as necessary.
subcontrols.description: Assesses Compliance with Privacy Commitments of Vendors and Business Partners -  On a periodic and as-needed basis, the entity assesses compliance by vendors and business partners with the entity's privacy commitments and requirements and takes corrective action as necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly review your vendors and partners' adherence to your privacy standards. Use questionnaires, audits, or assessments to evaluate their practices. Document findings, track identified risks, and ensure prompt corrective action if deficiencies are found. This process should be ongoing to maintain compliance.

name: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components (infrastructure, data, and software) to manage capacity demand and to enable the implementation of additional capacity to help meet its objectives.
description: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components (infrastructure, data, and software) to manage capacity demand and to enable the implementation of additional capacity to help meet its objectives.

subcontrols.name: Measures Current Usage - The use of the system components is measured to establish a baseline for capacity management and to use when evaluating the risk of impaired availability due to capacity constraints.
subcontrols.description: Measures Current Usage - The use of the system components is measured to establish a baseline for capacity management and to use when evaluating the risk of impaired availability due to capacity constraints.
subcontrols.guidance: To fulfill this SOC2 control, regularly track system resource usage (CPU, memory, storage, network) to establish a baseline. Analyze these metrics to identify trends and potential bottlenecks. Forecast future capacity needs based on usage patterns. Proactively address capacity constraints to prevent performance issues and ensure service availability. Finally, document your process.

subcontrols.name: Forecasts Capacity - The expected average and peak use of system components is forecasted and compared to system capacity and associated tolerances. Forecasting considers capacity in the event of the failure of system components that constrain capacity.
subcontrols.description: Forecasts Capacity - The expected average and peak use of system components is forecasted and compared to system capacity and associated tolerances. Forecasting considers capacity in the event of the failure of system components that constrain capacity.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply with the "Forecasts Capacity" SOC2 control, regularly forecast average and peak system resource usage. Compare these forecasts to your system's capacity and defined tolerances. Plan for component failures, considering their impact on capacity.  Monitor actual usage against forecasts, adjusting as needed to prevent capacity overruns. Document your forecasting methodology, assumptions, and results.

subcontrols.name: Makes Changes Based on Forecasts - The system change management process is initiated when forecasted usage exceeds capacity tolerances.
subcontrols.description: Makes Changes Based on Forecasts - The system change management process is initiated when forecasted usage exceeds capacity tolerances.
subcontrols.guidance: When forecasted usage exceeds capacity limits, trigger the system change management process. This proactive approach ensures sufficient resources are available.  Changes should be planned, tested, and implemented to address the capacity needs. This control focuses on preventing performance issues through data-driven adjustments. Document the forecasts, thresholds, and implemented changes.

name: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections, software, data back-up processes, and recovery infrastructure to meet its objectives.
description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections, software, data back-up processes, and recovery infrastructure to meet its objectives.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Environmental Threats - As part of the risk assessment process, management identifies environmental threats that could impair the availability of the system, including threats resulting from adverse weather, failure of environmental control systems, electrical discharge, fire, and water.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Environmental Threats - As part of the risk assessment process, management identifies environmental threats that could impair the availability of the system, including threats resulting from adverse weather, failure of environmental control systems, electrical discharge, fire, and water.
subcontrols.guidance: Your organization must proactively identify environmental risks to system availability. This includes hazards like weather events, environmental control failures, and electrical issues.  Document your risk assessment process and the specific environmental threats considered. Implement controls to mitigate identified risks and maintain system uptime. Regularly review and update your assessment.

subcontrols.name: Designs Detection Measures - Detection measures are implemented to identify anomalies that could result from environmental threat events.
subcontrols.description: Designs Detection Measures - Detection measures are implemented to identify anomalies that could result from environmental threat events.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, establish proactive methods to find unusual activity related to environmental threats. This includes monitoring systems for unusual data patterns or performance dips. Implement automated alerts and notifications when anomalies exceed defined thresholds. Regularly review and refine these detection measures based on threat intelligence and system performance. Ensure documented procedures and personnel are in place to promptly investigate and respond to any detected anomalies.

subcontrols.name: Implements and Maintains Environmental Protection Mechanisms -  Management implements and maintains environmental protection mechanisms to prevent and mitigate against environmental events.
subcontrols.description: Implements and Maintains Environmental Protection Mechanisms -  Management implements and maintains environmental protection mechanisms to prevent and mitigate against environmental events.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your organization identifies potential environmental risks (e.g., data center power outages, natural disasters) and establishes preventative measures.  Document these measures in policies and procedures, covering aspects like backup power, disaster recovery plans, and waste disposal.  Regularly test and review these plans for effectiveness and update as needed.  Train relevant personnel on environmental protection procedures.  Finally, evidence of these practices should be retained to demonstrate compliance.

subcontrols.name: Implements Alerts to Analyze Anomalies - Management implements alerts that are communicated to personnel for analysis to identify environmental threat events.
subcontrols.description: Implements Alerts to Analyze Anomalies - Management implements alerts that are communicated to personnel for analysis to identify environmental threat events.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement automated alerts for unusual system behavior.  These alerts should trigger rapid communication to designated personnel.  Personnel must analyze these alerts promptly to identify and respond to potential threats.  Document alert triggers, analysis procedures, and response actions.  Regularly review and refine alert configurations based on threat intelligence and incident analysis.

subcontrols.name: Responds to Environmental Threat Events - Procedures are in place for responding to environmental threat events and for evaluating the effectiveness of those policies and procedures on a periodic basis. This includes automatic mitigation systems (for example, uninterruptable power system and generator back-up subsystem).
subcontrols.description: Responds to Environmental Threat Events - Procedures are in place for responding to environmental threat events and for evaluating the effectiveness of those policies and procedures on a periodic basis. This includes automatic mitigation systems (for example, uninterruptable power system and generator back-up subsystem).
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure you have documented procedures to address environmental threats like power outages or natural disasters. These procedures should detail your response plan, including the use of backup systems like UPS and generators. Regularly test your response procedures to ensure their effectiveness and make necessary adjustments. Document all tests and any improvements made.

subcontrols.name: Communicates and Reviews Detected Environmental Threat Events - Detected environmental threat events are communicated to and reviewed by the individuals responsible for the management of the system, and actions are taken, if necessary.
subcontrols.description: Communicates and Reviews Detected Environmental Threat Events - Detected environmental threat events are communicated to and reviewed by the individuals responsible for the management of the system, and actions are taken, if necessary.
subcontrols.guidance: Identify and alert responsible personnel promptly about any detected environmental threats (e.g., power outages, floods).  Document the event, its impact, and the communication details.  Regularly review these events and responses with the relevant teams. This review should identify any necessary improvements to prevent future occurrences. Ensure actions are taken based on the review findings.

subcontrols.name: Determines Data Requiring Backup - Data is evaluated to determine whether backup is required.
subcontrols.description: Determines Data Requiring Backup - Data is evaluated to determine whether backup is required.
subcontrols.guidance: Identify all critical data needing protection from loss. Categorize data based on its importance and recovery needs. Establish clear criteria for what data merits backup (e.g., customer information, financial records). Document the identified data and rationale for backup decisions. Regularly review and update this determination as data and business needs evolve.

subcontrols.name: Performs Data Backup - Procedures are in place for backing up data, monitoring to detect back-up failures, and initiating corrective action when such failures occur.
subcontrols.description: Performs Data Backup - Procedures are in place for backing up data, monitoring to detect back-up failures, and initiating corrective action when such failures occur.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a regular data backup schedule. Ensure backup integrity by monitoring backup success and failure rates.  Automate alerts for failures.  Quickly address failed backups with defined recovery steps. Regularly test the restoration process to validate data recoverability.

subcontrols.name: Addresses Offsite Storage - Back-up data is stored in a location at a distance from its principal storage location sufficient that the likelihood of a security or environmental threat event affecting both sets of data is reduced to an appropriate level.
subcontrols.description: Addresses Offsite Storage - Back-up data is stored in a location at a distance from its principal storage location sufficient that the likelihood of a security or environmental threat event affecting both sets of data is reduced to an appropriate level.
subcontrols.guidance: Ensure your offsite backup location is geographically distant from your primary data center to mitigate the risk of a disaster affecting both. Verify physical and logical security at the offsite location. Document the distance and the rationale for its selection, considering potential threats. Regularly test the backups to ensure data integrity and recovery capabilities. Review and update the offsite storage strategy periodically.

subcontrols.name: Implements Alternate Processing Infrastructure - Measures are implemented for migrating processing to alternate infrastructure in the event normal processing infrastructure becomes unavailable.
subcontrols.description: Implements Alternate Processing Infrastructure - Measures are implemented for migrating processing to alternate infrastructure in the event normal processing infrastructure becomes unavailable.
subcontrols.guidance: To ensure business continuity, establish a plan for migrating operations to backup infrastructure. This plan should detail procedures for data transfer, system failover, and user access. Regularly test the alternate processing infrastructure to validate its effectiveness. Document the entire process including roles and responsibilities. This helps minimize downtime during outages.

name: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.
description: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.

subcontrols.name: Implements Business Continuity Plan Testing - Business continuity plan testing is performed on a periodic basis. The testing includes (1) development of testing scenarios based on threat likelihood and magnitude; (2) consideration of system components from across the entity that can impair the availability; (3) scenarios that consider the potential for the lack of availability of key personnel; and (4) revision of continuity plans and systems based on test results.
subcontrols.description: Implements Business Continuity Plan Testing - Business continuity plan testing is performed on a periodic basis. The testing includes (1) development of testing scenarios based on threat likelihood and magnitude; (2) consideration of system components from across the entity that can impair the availability; (3) scenarios that consider the potential for the lack of availability of key personnel; and (4) revision of continuity plans and systems based on test results.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly test your Business Continuity Plan (BCP) using scenarios reflecting potential threats, including system outages and key personnel unavailability.  These tests should span all critical system components. Analyze test outcomes, and update your BCP and systems accordingly. This iterative process ensures plan effectiveness.

subcontrols.name: Tests Integrity and Completeness of Back-Up Data - The integrity and completeness of back-up information is tested on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.description: Tests Integrity and Completeness of Back-Up Data - The integrity and completeness of back-up information is tested on a periodic basis.
subcontrols.guidance: Regularly verify the integrity and completeness of your backups. This can involve restoring a sample of data to ensure it's usable. Document the testing process, including the frequency and results. Address any identified issues promptly to maintain data recovery capabilities. This control ensures you can restore lost or corrupted data.

name: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Confidential information - Procedures are in place to identify and designate confidential information when it is received or created and to determine the period over which the confidential information is to be retained.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Confidential information - Procedures are in place to identify and designate confidential information when it is received or created and to determine the period over which the confidential information is to be retained.
subcontrols.guidance: To satisfy this SOC2 control, establish a clear process for recognizing confidential information, whether received or created. Implement methods for labeling and designating this data. Document and enforce retention periods for each type of confidential information. This helps protect sensitive data throughout its lifecycle. Regularly review and update the process.

subcontrols.name: Protects Confidential Information from Destruction - Procedures are in place to protect confidential information from erasure or destruction during the specified retention period of the information.
subcontrols.description: Protects Confidential Information from Destruction - Procedures are in place to protect confidential information from erasure or destruction during the specified retention period of the information.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement data retention policies detailing storage duration and disposal methods for confidential information. Securely store data backups and maintain procedures for their restoration. Enforce access controls to prevent unauthorized data deletion. Regularly audit and test these procedures to ensure compliance. Finally, implement physical and logical security to protect data integrity during its lifecycle.

name: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.
description: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Confidential Information for Destruction - Procedures are in place to identify confidential information requiring destruction when the end of the retention period is reached.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Confidential Information for Destruction - Procedures are in place to identify confidential information requiring destruction when the end of the retention period is reached.
subcontrols.guidance: To meet this SOC2 control, establish clear procedures for identifying confidential data slated for destruction.  This includes cataloging information, defining retention periods, and automating data lifecycle management. Regularly audit systems and data repositories to ensure compliance.  Finally, document the entire process, demonstrating adherence to the retention schedule and secure destruction methods.

subcontrols.name: Destroys Confidential Information - Procedures are in place to erase or otherwise destroy confidential information that has been identified for destruction.
subcontrols.description: Destroys Confidential Information - Procedures are in place to erase or otherwise destroy confidential information that has been identified for destruction.
subcontrols.guidance: Implement a documented process for securely destroying confidential data. This includes identifying data slated for deletion and choosing appropriate destruction methods (e.g., shredding, secure deletion software). Ensure procedures are consistently followed and tracked. Regularly audit the process to verify effectiveness. Retain documentation of destruction to meet compliance requirements.

name: The entity obtains or generates, uses, and communicates relevant, quality information regarding the objectives related to processing, including definitions of data processed and product and service specifications, to support the use of products and services.
description: The entity obtains or generates, uses, and communicates relevant, quality information regarding the objectives related to processing, including definitions of data processed and product and service specifications, to support the use of products and services.

subcontrols.name: Identifies Information Specifications - The entity identifies information specifications required to support the use of products and services.
subcontrols.description: Identifies Information Specifications - The entity identifies information specifications required to support the use of products and services.
subcontrols.guidance: To comply, thoroughly document all data specifications needed for your products/services, detailing format, content, and security requirements.  This includes input, processing, and output information. Ensure the specifications are accessible to relevant teams like development, operations, and customer support.  Regularly review and update specifications to reflect changes.  This promotes accurate data handling and consistent service delivery.

subcontrols.name:
Defines Data Necessary to Support a Product or Service - When data is provided as part of a service or product or as part of a reporting obligation related to a product or service:
(1)    The definition of the data is available to the users of the data
(2)    The definition of the data includes the following information:
 -     The population of events or instances included in the data
 -     The nature of each element (for example, field) of the data (that is, the event or instance to which the data element relates, for example, transaction price of a sale of XYZ Corporation stock for the last trade in that stock on a given day)
 -     Source(s) of the data
 -     The unit(s) of measurement of data elements (for example, fields)
 -     The accuracy/correctness/precision of measurement
 -     The uncertainty or confidence interval inherent in each data element and in the population of those elements
 -     The date the data was observed or the period of time during which the events relevant to the data occurred
 -     The factors in addition to the date and period of time used to determine the inclusion and exclusion of items in the data elements and population
(3)    The definition is complete and accurate.
(4)    The description of the data identifies any information that is necessary to understand each data element and the population in a manner consistent with its definition and intended purpose (meta-data) that has not been included within the data.
